description:
Very nice coffeehouse near my hotel.  High quality coffee and sandwiches even breakfast items.  Great location, very clean, good customer service, and busy at times.  Just a little bland kinda customer service for a coffee joint but it's Sf so it can be expected.

Definitely be back for the coffee, just very high quality, not the highest but great.
author: Kevin O.

description:
Great corner store coffee shop with plants galore! It's everything you'd imagine a hipster coffee shop to be, avocado toast and all. 

I came here on a Saturday and while most tables were full, it wasn't packed at full capacity. This place can be a little tricky to navigate once inside because since it's a corner shop at an angle, you find yourself dodging patrons and tables.

I ordered the avo toast about $4 plus $2 extra for the poached egg addition and a regular chai ($4). With tip my breakfast came out to about $14. SF is pricey even for a slice of bread with earth on it :)

The avo toast was a Pinterest dream with slices of avocado, salt, pepper, and an egg. The chai was light and airy although I preferred my chai a little stronger to be honest. I'll have to return again to try the rest of the expresso offerings to be a solid review but for now my love of plants and people watching way this is a solid coffee shop. I would come hither again!
author: Connie M.

description:
Favorite coffee shop ! 
Delicious Shakshuka, beautiful avocado toast, breakfast sandwiches are super tasty . 
Food arrives fast, clean, fresh.
Knowing the taste of Réveille's coffee, I can't have coffee somewhere else. 
Staff is always friendly, welcoming, interesting to talk with. The ambience is great.
author: Karina M.

description: Matcha latte: I liked it how they didn't skimp on the matcha and the latte wasn't overloaded with sugar. However, there was quite a bit of matcha residue at the bottom of the cup. I found the drink to be quite comforting until I had to spit out a green tea stem from my mouth.
author: I L.

description:
Absolutely love the vibe and location here. I was staying just a couple blocks away for the weekend and a friend walked us here for our (very necessary) morning coffee. Over the course of the weekend I had a regular coffee, an americano, and a matcha latte here, each of which I really enjoyed. The shop itself is pretty small but really pretty. Everything from the fresh flowers to the branded cups to the light fixtures made me happy here.  

The only issue I had here is that I liked it so much, I came back the next morning on my way to run an errand. I showed up right at 8 am, which is when they open on Sundays, and the two younger baristas inside seemed annoyed that they had to unlock the door for me. They were also blasting John Mayer and none of the chairs were set up yet, so maybe they got in late or something. Anywho, not a huge deal and I'd definitely be back next time I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Megan R.

description: My favorite neighborhood coffee joint in North Beach. Gorgeous interior (very modern, light, and lots of succulents). Their matcha latte is great and the avocado toast is delicious. So is the breakfast sandwich. Slightly on the pricey side, but very comparable to other places nearby.
author: Lillian W.

description:
Great wifi, great drinks, and awesome service. My biggest gripe is they play their music way too loud that it defeats the purpose of me coming here to do any work. 

It's difficult for me to take calls or meetings when I am working remotely because the music is way too loud.

Otherwise, I love the food and coffee here.
author: Alicia L.

description:
I really enjoy this space as a nice place to catch up with a friend, have a coffee on the way to work, or take a long lunch break outside on the patio. In my opinion, the space/ambiance here is better than the food and coffee.

I used to work around the corner from this location, so I've been a consistent and frequent visitor. I enjoy a good iced coffee, particularly on those Sept/Oct Indian summer days, but whenever I get one here I am always a little disappointed. It usually tastes overly acidic, like it's been brewed too long. It's not horrible (and don't get me wrong, I drink it every time), but when the price approaches $5 for a coffee, you expect a bit more. 

The food here is also OK. Most are small plates, avocado toast, granola, etc., that you could easily make at home yourself, and thus feel overpriced. All in all, if you stick to the hot espresso or tea drinks and pastries, you will not be disappointed - and definitely linger to enjoy the space!
author: Kathryn P.

description:
Réveille Coffee Co. 

What an awesome location on a corner and near Little Italy of San Francisco. 

First off, I highly recommend walking the streets of Little Italy and Chinatown. There are so many restaurants, shops, markets (with loads of fresh fruits and veggies). We took a free (name your own price) walking tour through the area and it was worth it (read my other review about it). 

Anyways, as I was saying. This coffee shop is located on the corner of a street and you can't miss it. The sun shines in the shop making it warm and bright. The menu is simple and I asked if the chai syrup was vegan and it was so I ordered a dirty chai with non cow milk in it. Making it vegan of course! 

The baristas were very nice and made the drinks face. My significant other ordered a macchiato and it had beautiful latte art. 

There's a restroom in the back and complimentary water station too! 

Back to the dirty chai, it was good, a little too foamy for my liking and I would have preferred a little more of a cinnamon taste to it. But I would come back again. 

As always, 
Go vegan (or at least try)
author: Peyton C.

description:
Ordered a regular cup of java. No specials.  My daughter brought me here because it's her regular coffee hangout.

It is located at the corner of Columbus and Kearny.  Prime location since it's surrounded by North Beach, Chinatown, Telegraph Hill, and The Financial District.

There is ample indoor and outdoor seating.  Very ....... chic.
Coffee was good.  The coffee is strong enough to come through the added cream & honey, but not so strong like an expresso.

I give an A-OK 3-Star because I've had different, not better, just different coffee.  Pricing is comparable at $3.25, but I'll take my Starbucks every time.

Will I come back. Yes, but I will not go out of my way to return.
author: Randy L.

description:
Bored at work, at home or in school? Grab your laptop and spend your day here! Make yourself comfortable either inside where the modern interior and unique architecture fulfills the cafe with daylight or outside where you can charge some vitamin D while getting your work done.

In case you'll get thirsty for strong and good coffee or hungry for a healthy lunch - no worries, they got you covered! Wi-Fi is available.

So what are you waiting for? Go and check it out!
author: Stefani K.

description:
I've only tried the green tea latte here but it is pretty good. The flavor is on point and not overly sweet like the ones at Starbucks. You can taste the richness of the matcha, blended in with the creaminess of the milk.

The cafe itself is quite nice and relaxing, being right in the North Beach area. It is clean, and there is seating along the counters and in the back.
author: Tyler T.

description:
New office space, new places to explore.

Reveille was the first coffee place on my list. Quite a number of coffee places on edges of streets; And this is one.

I was drawn in by the hibiscus peppermint tea. A combination that doesn't sound like it works, but it does. It is so refreshing. If you have a sore throat, this is the perfect drink. Besides this terrific tea, they also have coffee drinks and snacks/lunches (sammies, salads, cookies, pastries).

For China Town area, this place is decently hipster. A good amount of stool seating.

The first guy who helped us at the counter was super nice. I mentioned the tea and he offered us a sample. My reaction was enough to convince my coworker to also get the tea. Yeah, it was good. Then my coworker asked another guy where to put his empty plate and the guy said "The area in the back over there would be nice." Is that a bit of snark I suspect, sir? (it's all in the tone). Anyway, I thought it was funny. 

I love places with amazing tea, and I can't hide it. Returning for the tea. 100% rate of return (ROR).
author: Libby J.

description:
A Réveille matcha latte a day would make me a very happy lady. I'd also be set back $2,317 a year. But what's adulting without budgeting for the important things in life?

This is a well-lit, hipster-chic space. Friendly, non-snooty baristas who make a mean latte. If you're lucky enough to snag a seat, it's a great place to work (if you're ok with music), catch up with friends, or a quick-midday coffee break.

Warning: While there are 2 bathroom stalls in the back, the wait time can get lengthy. Plan bathroom breaks accordingly.
author: Deanna C.

description:
I love their beans! I have been looking for a nice rich espresso grind for a while and other coffee shops in the area have disappointed so far. 

If you have a stovetop espresso machine like I do, the paradise espresso beans are great!
author: Hanna S.

description:
If you look up the definition of "hidden gem" in the dictionary, there's a picture of Réveille in all its oval-shaped glory. Who would imagine that, sandwiched between a bunch of strip clubs and sex shops, there exists a coffee shop and breakfast spot so magnificent it practically defies description? Yet there it is, complete with delightful outdoor seating on a block that's chock-full of terrific people watching.

What makes it so great? Let me count the ways:

1) Réveille translates literally as "wake up," and there is no better description for what will happen to your senses after a few sips of their coffee. I consume caffeine the way most people breath air, and one Americano from this joint lasted me half the day.

2) I also ordered their veggie frittata, a side of three additional eggs and an arugula salad. The frittata was fairly flavorless, hence the missing star on this review, but the salad (served tossed with a delightful lemon dressing) and eggs (obviously cooked in real butter) were terrific. 

3) Without question, the restaurant's Pièce De Résistance is its almond butter and jam toast. Seriously. Order this even if you aren't hungry. It's incomparable.

I picked Réveille on a whim after initially trying the coffee shop next door, which was inexplicably closed. Once I was done with my meal, I considered that twist of fate to be serendipitous rather than disappointing, and will gladly return to this place any time I'm in the bay area.
author: Charles G.

description:
What a beautiful cafe! I love the natural feel of this place especially when just right outside it feels like a hustle and bustle all the time. 

I got the matcha latte and it was delicious. It tastes like good quality whole milk with matcha powder. The latte art was also beautiful :) 

I would probably come back to try some other items on the menu. I can't wait to come back and just relax here!
author: Joyce S.

description:
Oh Reville, my dog, my around the corner cafe! I hate to do it to you, but I can't let our long term relationship determine this candid review. Never. Ever.

You're slipping. You served me a stale almond croissant today.

 I know fresh, and I know stale when biting into one and this was most definitely the later. So I asked to get get something else, a fruit cheese Danish. Yeah that looked great. Again....stale.

The person who helped me said they had a vendor that supplies baked goods to them. It really does not matter to me, the end consumer, who's to blame. The fact is this place is serving stale crap. And it's not cheap crap. It's expensive, stale baked crap.

No excuses, just hoping they please fix. Not sure how long until I get confidence back in this place, but for now I will be going across street to The Station Cafe as I have never gotten served old food there. Why risk it again when another option is so close. Sorry, but not sorry.
author: Richard L.

description:
Chai!

So I tried there chai last weekend and it was delightful. It didn't give the spice down my throat that i personally prefer, but it also wasn't super sweet. 

the joint itself was packed but had great lighting.
there is seating by the window. That prime location is perfect for people watching. 

They do accept card (alot of places near here don't)

the price is average for what I am used to for Chai
The workers were decently friendly
They had coffee options that other people seemed to enjoy. 

If you are walking from china town this is a good choice for you to stop at. 
The interior is modern and chick. I saw a lot of people getting work done and enjoying there drinks. This seems like  plae you could spend hours.
author: Tabitha D.

description: I've ordered a cup of java and a chocolate chip cookie. Not spacious, but the location and environment are great. Good access to Financial District, but not city side, you can meet up and chat with your friends or business people slow. Actually, this time I used this cafe to meet up with my old friend. We could enjoy talking there ;)
author: Shun Y.

description: Great atmosphere, delicious food, amazing coffee and excellent service! We had a lovely experience here!
author: Katelyn F.

description: I wasn't hip enough for good service here. AND It was $12 for 2 medium size bad specialty coffees.
author: Krista T.

description: The matcha latte was delicious! Their food items also smelled amazing! I'll have to try some next time.  I love that the shop has plenty of seating around with natural light from the big windows. If there's no avail seating inside, there are some seating outside. If all else fail, take your drink and walk around a bit. The location is within walking distance to Chinatown, Little Italy, or the Ferry Building, Embarcadero area ... all amazing places to venture with drink in hand!
author: Shong H.

description:
Yelp reviews brought me here and I am glad they did. 

This coffee shop is is located in little Italy and it blends in with the beauty that is San Francisco. The large windows bring both natural light and the wonderful view of the city. There are counters along the windows and small tables people to study, chat, people watch, or just admire the view. 
The drink menu is small but they do offer what you need along with soy and almond options for about 50 cents extra? I ordered the mocha (you can never go wrong with a mocha). It tasted different than the other ones I had in other coffee shops but thats probably because they roast their own beans at this place. The latte art was stellar. The drink was wonderful.

I didn't get a chance to try their food menu but, they offer avocado toast, sandwiches, salads, and pastries. All of which looked appetizing so check them out. 

Overall, this is a wonderful place and I am glad I found it. If I am ever in this beautiful city again, this is the first place I would go to for coffee.
author: Yoandra V.

description:
TL;DR hip coffee 

Reveille serves a solid latte. They have a small menu, but they have the essentials. I got a latte, and everything about it was perfect, the espresso, the steamed milk, and the latte art! My friend got a matcha latte, and hers had a cute bear on top. 

They have a circular layout and have a super modern feel w the large windows all around. Perfect place to get your Insta pic!
author: Sophia L.

description: I tried Reveille Coffee in desperate need of a good caffeine kick last weekend, and had the best cappuccino I have ever had. I wish I could comment more about them but it was a quick in-and-out go. The staff was friendly and the place seems like a nice spot to relax with a book and grab a nice light breakfast or lunch. Can't wait to come back!
author: Doug P.

description:
Reveille has two locations in the city, and I picked this one solely due to it's good view (as well as a better decoration inside). I really loved the grand oval table and the better sunshine in the room. 

It was not crowded at all during workday morning, so that I could sit down and enjoy some quiet moment. The coffee was nicely done too, loved the Reveille coffee bean.

Too bad they do not carry skim milk, only 1%; but this is ok.
author: Elaine H.

description:
On the corner of Columbus, this modern coffee shop fits right into its surroundings. I've been here several times in the early morning to work, and the table seating gives an excellent view to the cars, buses, and people in the morning.

Beginning around 7:40AM, this place starts to get busy as people come in for their coffee. I haven't tried their food here yet, but it does look very appetizing. 

While the environment is perfect for work as there are two outlets on the walls (people don't really use them in the morning). However, the coffee here is definitely on the expensive side. My go-to drink at any coffee place is a latte. For $4.25, you can get one here. Add 75 cents for almondmilk. I was a bit shocked I paid $5.53 for an almondmilk latte. While I do like this environment, the price is a shocker. I suppose since its on the border of Chinatown and North Beach, that would result in the higher priced coffee. 

The service here is great. At 7AM, the barista greets their customers with a warm, and welcoming smile. This place is 4 star worthy, but the price knocks off one star.
author: Teresa C.

description: 10/10 recommend their lattes. Very bold coffee without the bitterness and the location is decorated with plants & white tile making it a friendly and welcoming place. It's rather small so it's perfectly for cozy working or a coffee date with a friend.
author: Angella G.

description:
This place has fallen flat on its face

Empty today. Really slow. Green Tea and Shakshuka. Took 42 minutes for the Shakshuka to show up - Cold.

It showed up cold 20 minutes after I followed up on the order.  When I followed up, They said there was some confusion. Confusion? - was a standard order.

I want to support my neighborhood business, but with treatment like this.... it's hard to.

Staff turnover is showing. This place was once awesome. Now... terrible. It's just sad it's this way.
author: Mike K.

description:
Definitely one of the best matcha lattes in SF. The only other comparable place is CoffeeShop in South Mission/Bernal Heights.

The matcha latte here is consistently great, not too sweet, with strong matcha flavor. I take ppl here from out of town and always get a cup when I'm passing by.

It looks like there's wifi since some ppl settle in with computers. Also good outdoor park-like seating for when it's nice out, though it's kinda on the side of the street that doesn't get too much sun.
author: Jeanie N.

description: Such a cute cafe. Love going here for lattes in the AM. Looks like a great place to meet up with friends or go to during work hours. So much room - lots of tables. Love the decorations / vibe.
author: Emily M.

description:
A solid Reveille outlet that makes good use of an otherwise irregular, triangular-shaped cornerfront venue. 

The coffee bar is where the action is, and it takes up most of the "bulk" of the interior. That having been said, there's a modest amount of seating at counters and stools along the windows, and when it's nice out, there's even more seating inside.

Service is fast, efficient, and fairly friendly, and, of course, the coffee is quite good too. A great place to turn to for coffee in this area that's not a major-chain establishment.
author: Vincent L.

description: Great coffee and an equally great ambiance! Came here on a Monday at around 8am and it wasn't too crowded. I got a mocha, and it wasn't too sweet, which I was kinda bummed about since I have a huge sweet tooth, but it wasn't anything too bad. I sat by the window, and the music in the background added to the great chill atmosphere. The service was quick and efficient, and I would definitely come back if I'm in the area!
author: Lisa C.

description:
I first spotted Reveille on GMaps/Yelp when a friend and I were looking for a quick place to stop and recharge (ourselves and also our phones, heh) before dinner. It's a well-designed space that's in the middle of SF, with huge windows and tons of natural light.

While my friend and I weren't in the mood for coffee, the drinks they had looked pretty good. We ended up getting the Ajna tea (with flavors of anise hyssop, tulsi, and lavender) and one of the bottled rose lemonades. We found some space up by the bar and settled in.

Anise hyssop tastes and smells like anise, but are part of the mint family. Tulsi is better known as holy basil. The tea was super light and you could taste a little bit of licorice flavor, but the basil wasn't super strong. The lavender, however, was very prominent. It was a super light tea. The rose lemonade was, however, my favorite! It's carbonated too, so the rose, ginger, and lemon flavor was light and refreshing. I'm quite glad they stocked it.

I'm looking forward to coming back here and being able to try the coffee and food (the kitchen was closed when we came). If you come here, take some time to soak in the atmosphere and the SF views outside the window. Try to come early though, so you can snag one of the rare outlets inside.

And for those who need it:
Wi-Fi: paradise
Password: espresso
author: Catherine H.

description: Enjoyed my breakfast. Cool, friendly vibe. If you can, get a nice seat by the window for some people watching.
author: M W.

description: Such a cute little coffee shop in the middle of SF. The barista was friendly and helpful and my matcha latte ($4.75) was perfect for the chilly day.
author: Annie N.

description: Quick and tasty foods! I had chocolate croissant, sandwich and latte! I love the interior design and up beat energy in the cafe!
author: Tsendsuren B.

description:
Stopped by for some coffee after lunch. I got the Matcha Latte and he got the regular Latte. I'm not picky about drinks and I often judge on the latte art, which was top notch at here.

We sat by the window (there's ample seating all along the bright windows). We chatted and people watched. I wish I had more time to sit and enjoy the afternoon.
author: Yi Z.

description:
Small coffee shop with great design and outside seating. Coffee was great and I also enjoyed the music playing in the background. Perfect for the work I was doing. Seating was tight inside, but they definitely maximized the space in this small shop. They had a lot of countertop space with shades for the windows to minimize lighting.

Restroom is shared with other restaurants (wine bar) and was clean and easily accessible. Outdoor seating was spacious and I would have sat there (great day great weather) except i needed an outlet.
author: David Y.

description:
I just had the most awful breakfast sandwich. It was the sandwich named after the place. It had a fried egg, leeks and kale. Its taste and texture strongly suggested it had been made hours before and briefly (although ineffectively - all ingredients were lukewarm to cool) rewarmed. Admittedly, it was a quarter to 2pm when I ordered it and they serve breakfast until 2 on Sundays. But if you are incapable of serving something edible, I believe you should not serve it.

The bottom toast was soggy and the top toast was crusty and stale. The egg peeking out from the hole in the center of the top toast had formed a thick rubbery crust on the yolk. Maybe it would have been good a few hours earlier. I had two bites before deciding I could not eat it.

Also I'm suspicious of the plate this was served on because it was a round, flat slate with a cushioned bottom, so I know it can't go in the dishwasher and I doubt it can even be submerged in water.

The BF had ordered a shakshuka, which is the source of the only stars in this review, as it tasted good and the poached eggs in it seemed like they had recently been poached.
author: C J.

description:
In terms of hipster coffee shops this place is pretty standard with its soothing indie rock and coffee options that don't really mean much to an amateur like me. 

While I can't really comment on the coffee beyond the fact that I can tell it's at least in par with other comparable shops (Philz, etc.), I can appreciate the ample amount of counter space and outdoor seating available. This is aided by the public parklet that is on the sidewalk by the shop. It seems that there are outlets inside for those wanting to do work, while outside is nice for people watching as it's quite a busy intersection. While I was here there were plenty of people having informal chats, doing work, and just passing the time.

The staff is also really friendly, which is always a plus at a coffee shop. I'll definitely be coming back in the future when I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Jenny D.

description: Clean coffee shop in North Beach. The service is friendly and inviting. And genuine. The cappuccino was beautifully created but I could taste the bitterness in the coffee bean which I didn't care for. Good place to study and pleasant aesthetic
author: Elizabeth G.

description: Came here on a Sunday afternoon to get my coffee fix. The cashier was very friendly and welcoming. I ordered an iced mocha and an iced americano. The iced mocha tasted good, but would probably be better hot because they use real chocolate (which is awesome) so it doesn't melt well in ice (oops, my bad). The americano, on the other hand, did not taste good and had a strange sour taste to it. For the cost, I was disappointed in the quality.
author: Jamie D.

description:
I really like trying new coffee places and I always get lattes. I think the coffee here was good. Not super strong, but it was good. My husband got a vanilla latte. The syrup for that is just simple syrup with vanilla extract I believe. It wasn't too sweet, which was perfect. 

The service was fine, the place was cute. Nicely lit by natural sunlight so this would be a good place for studying and working.
author: Susan K.

description: Hell. Yes. Get the iced mocha and a croissant! Presentation is beautiful, the vibe in here is nice, and the location is clean and pristine. Would definitely recommend. Also, the staff is so pleasant.
author: Cody J.

description: Was totally fine, nothing special but nothing wrong. I never like when places charge extra for soy or almond milks. Most people seemed to be working on their laptops and seating wasn't the easiest.
author: Jess C.

description: I used to love coming here. Latest crop of baristas haven't been great unfortunately. Espresso shots have been really weak and served in paper even when there's plenty of ceramic. I get that they maybe don't want to do dishes but it's pretty unusual in SF to get espresso in paper. Hope they can up their game so I can remove this bad review.
author: Nathan B.

description: Lukewarm sour tasting macchiato from a haughty barista. Cool location and store - perhaps to cool to give good taste and service.
author: S L.

description: Your Americano had me at first sip.  I have to spread the news that your coffee is the best I have tasted so far in fog town!  Also, it's near both North Beach and Chinatown. I could do my shopping and enjoy excellent coffee.
author: Wing W.

description: Visited this cafe during my visit to SF and purchased a bag of coffee bean. That is by bar the best coffee bean I've had. I'm a coffee lover and been to so many coffee shops in New York City but can't get any beans that taste as good Reveille's. Sadly they don't have a shop in the city, so I purchase the bean through their website instead. Despite the fact that the site charges you $8 worth of shipping, I'm still willing to pay for that!
author: Ally M.

description:
This coffee shop is located on the outskirts of north beach, bordering the financial district. 
The staff is always friendly and they make good drinks.
There are always people doing work on their computers here. They have free wifi.
I would recommend their lattes.
Parking is hard, but if your on foot it's worth a stop.
author: Kevin S.

description: Really adore this place! My barista was extremely friendly and welcoming which was a great way to start my early morning day! Great coffee, lots of outlets, fast WiFi, and a yummy menu selection. Great place to camp out and work for hours.
author: Kaylynn C.

description: This place is fine if you just want coffee and to work, but don't expect a satisfying breakfast to go along with it. They serve overpriced food for ants - their homestyle breakfast is a sorry, sorry excuse for a meal.
author: Hunter C.

description:
I love these little wedge coffee shops on acute corners... so acute!

... anyways, the coffee here was quite good if you like it black, they don't bother you with annoying questions like "would you like room for cream?".  No, I'm here to buy coffee, not cream!  And the views from their giant windows show off some pretty hills, architecture, and skyline SF has to offer.  

I think I'll need to go again on my next visit to try some other creations so I can get it that 5th star.
author: Matt C.

description: Not that they need another great review, but the coffee here is some of the best! Came. Also, when you buy a bag of beans, you get a free coffee as well. And the last time I was there w a friend getting a bag to bring her family back home - we were both offered a free coffee. And the coffee was amazing, had undertones of marshmallow, was clean and crisp tasting - perfectly brewed! Will always be back if I'm in the area for a great cup.
author: Annie S.

description: Wifi, outlets, great lighting, even better coffee, a classy menu... what more could you want from a coffee shop?! This place has a wonderful atmosphere and vibe that is great for any number of social engagements. The street view is lovely and if you don't have to worry about price, I'd definitely suggest indulging in a pastry or some lunch along with your coffee. You're paying for quality and the aesthetics as much as you're paying for taste and quantity but it is good none the less!
author: Quinn Li O.

description:
If you're looking for a great coffee in North Beach, then look no further than Réveille Coffee Co. In a neighborhood that's flooded with mediocre "Italian" espresso stands, it's tough to find a good cup of joe. Seriously, most of the coffee in North Beach is undrinkable in my opinion, so it's nice to have one option in the area. 

I'm a sucker for great espresso and usually order it at Réveille but, opted for a nice cold brew on such a hot day. The cold brew was poured over ice and just delicious. I'm pretty sure cold brew has a higher caffeine content because I'm always super wired after consumption. Side note, espresso is pronounced e-spres-oh. There is no X involved, so don't do it. It's one of my biggest pet peeves... :) 

The parklet is my favorite part of this coffee shop. It's super cool and one of the larger set ups in SF. Grab a coffee, post up in the parklet and enjoy the free wifi. Boom.
author: Benjamin F.

description:
This is a beautiful coffee shop. The ambiance is what makes it stand out and worth visiting...It's very simple, mostly black and white with the exception of the few succulents adorning the center of the shop where the baristas are. One has to really appreciate the open layout - it feels like an atrium. There is plenty of seating in front of street-facing windows to do shit on your laptop and charge up while you people watch. The customers that come here look like well-to-do, young, trendy professionals. 

There's also plenty of seating along the outside of the cafe. 

As for the coffee, I'm no connoisseur. I had a cappuccino and it was very non-pretentious and standard.
author: Yenny Z.

description:
I've been visiting different coffee spots in this neighborhood to seek the best place, and I think I just found it. Right off the bat, I was impressed by the fast service on a Sunday afternoon. 

I really like the decor and esthetics of this coffee shop. The simplicity of the indoor and outdoor seating area provided perfect setting to sit and chat. Also has free Wifi for those who want to sit and work. 

What I like best during my visit was definitely the iced latte. The aroma was very plesant, not  right in your face like many coffee places. It's hard to find a coffee place that doesn't use scorching hot water and gives my coffee an underlying burnt taste or that uses too much milk that tones down the coffee flavor. No need to check out other coffee spots in this area, I will be coming back to try other items on the menu. 

Did I mention how cute the cups are?
author: Nancy C.

description: Absolutely love Réveille. The coffee is strong. The shakshuka is incredible. Nice atmosphere. I like having breakfast with a friend here.
author: Seth D.

description: Alright first off the lady I was ordering from was a fucking bitch. They got my drink wrong, which was just an iced chai. But what ever that happens. So I drink this chai and it tasted like Habanero hot peppers, damn shit made me start coughing, thought I was damn near poisoned. I'm fucking pissed it was almost 5$ and I threw it away. Stupid hipster chain don't recommend unless you like damn fucking ghost peppers in your chai.
author: Maddie C.

description:
Really disappointing cappuccino for a third wave outlet, twice now on two separate occasions and two different baristas. Milk was scalding and approaching Starbucks level frothiness.  Espresso Shot can charitably be described as a coffee flavor. Their coffee truck two blocks away is much better.

Two stars for location and ambience.
author: S G.

description:
I stopped by Reveille Coffee Co. for a quick breakfast on my way to the airport last Sunday. They weren't busy at all, so I received my latte and prosciutto + poached egg toast within 5 minutes. The toast was generously topped with prosciutto, avocado, arugula, and a poached egg, but was definitely overpriced. My soy latte tasted alright but I was a bit bummed about the latte "art." 

I can see myself dropping in for a cup of coffee if I'm in the area, but I don't think I will go out of my way to visit Reveille Coffee Co.
author: Helen P.

description:
Awesome drawings with cream. Staff is great. Good price/quality ratio.
The coffee shop is good looking, wood and steel aspect, chairs outside to smoke.
author: Léo P.

description: Easily the biggest hipster asshole baristas in the city. This place sucks. Go across the street to station.
author: Dan L.

description:
3.5 STARS for above average coffee and espresso, and very mediocre (and expensive) avocado-egg toast.

Overall, Reveille is a cute coffee shop, good for a pick-me-up, but not a destination cafe.
author: Jess C.

description: Great coffee and tea shop on the edge of North Beach and downtown.  Ambience is versatile, good for catching up with friends or casual business meetings.
author: Alfred C.

description: I'm a coffee Roaster who was visiting SF and checking out some Great Coffee. Reveille does it RIGHT. One of the Best Cappuccino's I've had and the staff was friendly. Two bags came home with me!
author: David F.

description: Stopped by Réveille for coffee on an early afternoon and opted for a matcha latte instead, and I wasn't disappointed. It was fairly busy but not overwhelmingly so. What made this place an experience was the environment. I love the modern stylings of this coffee shop and the vibes that come with them. I like its location on the corner and how everything is set up. Inside feels very welcoming, and the staff are all very nice. Outlets aren't difficult to find, and there seems to be enough seating inside with some outdoor tables as well. It feels a bit expensive, as was my matcha latte, but the ambiance and overall feel of the shop fit in perfectly with its surroundings in the city.
author: Anh L.

description: We love everything about Réveille - the light and airy triangle building, mild and creamy lattes, and quirky friendly baristas.
author: Friea B.

description: Cute little coffee shop. The coffee was delicious and the seating outside (sparse and on a slanted hill) allowed me a great view of my all time favorite building in San Fran. Plus I could sit and drink my coffee, do work, and people watch.  The people behind the counter were friendly for the most part and the energy inside was good. Great wi-fi connection.
author: Nicole B.

description: Thanks to previous Yelpers, I set foot in the streets of SF on my last visit to seek out coffee and downtime here.  I had an excellent pour-over and amazing Chia pudding from a lovely seat at the window looking up the street to Chinatown.  Excellent service, clean and cool and comfortable ambiance.  I will return every time I am in this area and now that I am back across the bridge am craving going back already...
author: DeliaDana Z.

description:
Another solid coffee place in SF. Reveille is an architecturally interesting cafe because it's at the tip of a building. But they've done a really nice job with the space, and the floor to ceiling windows add a nice touch of natural light during the day.

Reveille has solid coffee. I typically just go for a vanilla latte and it's fairly well executed. Nothing super particularly exceptional, but certainly another great coffee option.
author: Jasmine X.

description:
I second Ben F's review - NB's coffee options are NOT GREAT. The third wave didn't seem to have arrived here yet, NB and coffee... it's kinda stuck in time.

Réveille to the rescue! First of all - location. On the corner of Kearny and Broadway, with tons of natural light. The store design is kept bright which adds on the welcoming and clean ambiance.

I always enjoyed their coffee - I'm more of a pour-over drinker, and their choices don't disappoint. You'll pay your $3-$4 per cup but hey, third wave.

Worth it.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
I decided to make a stop for coffee right after coming out of the gym. After passing by this place many times, I had intend to come in. Today, I came in for a latte and enjoyed it.

Friendly staff team, clean cafe, plenty of seats available inside and outside. Most importantly, the coffee tastes good. I really like seeing latte art, it is pure culinary creativity. Plenty of reasons to come here and with outdoor seating available, this is going to bring me back. Sitting outside is the best way to enjoy that pastry and coffee especially bright sunny days like today. Overall, very good first experience here at Reveille.

Reasons for rating:
- Seating available inside and outside
- Friendly staff team
- Clean cafe
- Very good coffee
- Free Wi-Fi

With this and another coffee shop across the street from here, there is always a place to get something to munch and sip on. Getting thirsty for a cup of coffee while waiting for the bus? Both coffee shops are here for you.

For those of you wondering what this unit used to be, I'll fill you guys in. This unit was previously occupied by a clothing store (I don't remember the name though).
author: Bennett W.

description:
Reveille is a gem. Never overloaded with people due to its location, even though it's a great beginning to trekking around the shops and parks in North Beach. It's rarer for cafes to have all of these qualities now: great coffee, tea, seating, food, spacious, has wifi and outlets! 

Still good since I first was introduced two years ago. I'll always get breakfast or lunch, coffee, or use as a workspace for a few hours. 

I recommend the shakshuka and toasts!
author: Kathy Z.

description: My first French breakfast after 6 months in USA: croissants are not bad but I smelt it's not broiled enough, the coffee espresso is good and filled correctly not like Palo Alto "store". Interesting coffee because I have drunk a good seed I think:a little bit "acid" but natural. I saw also other cups I thought that they had a good formation as barista. They can draw a heart or leaf in the cappuccino...and between every ordered they washed elements with hot water and the vapor of coffee machine. Serious and discreet service.
author: Marie-Claire L.

description: Came here on a day trip to the city with my daughter. Absolutely loved the vibe. We had iced almond milk lattes and shared an avocado toast. Both were delicious. Enjoyed the music and overall feel of the place. Baristas were friendly as well. Will definitely visit again the next time I'm in SF.
author: Brandie G.

description: Cold brew was great! Also super happy they had WiFi and outlets!
author: Kasey C.

description:
I came here for breakfast and ordered an avocado toast with an egg and a coffee. The toast was crunchy but not hard and the avocados tasted fresh, and I liked breaking the runny egg yolk with my fork. That said, it wasn't anything I couldn't make at home, but was reasonably priced for an avocado toast in SF.

The coffee was flavorful, though. Though I usually put some cream and milk in my coffee, I drank this black, and it tasted good.

The place was clean and the service was fast and top notch. The seating inside seemed pretty limited, but they had ample seating outside, but it's right next to a busy street. The neighborhood is scenic (rugged neighborhood city feel), so it draws a pretty hipster crowd.
author: Marcy S.

description: Sandwiches. Sandwiches. Sandwiches. Both pre-made and made to order are incredible. Arugula is super fresh. Have yet to try coffee but heard great things. Staff is very kind and they move fast. Turkey sandwich with bacon was brilliant. Aioli is a must! Outdoor seating is casual and perfect on a nice day.
author: John A.

description: I came in to study for a bit.. the ambiance was great, lots of natural light and seating. Theres regular tables and also high stool seating which work great if you're there for a long time and want to stand and work for a bit! I had the hot chocolate which was great, not overly sweet! The only thing I would say is that the music was a bit loud, so if you need peace and quiet to study then this wouldn't be the place for you.
author: Areeba Q.

description:
Réveille is beautiful! They do so many interesting things and play with their ambient light so well. They have a show or movie or something projected onto their high wall on one side, and it's mostly washed out by the light and there's no sound but it makes the place interesting and I love the idea! They've also got all sorts of cool, almost gas punk decorations going on, like giant industrial fans situated near their higher-level windows, but their materials are all sleek white or silver and such. 

Their food is great too! Beautifully made, especially their garden of an avocado toast!

Definitely a nerd for their décor though. My summer in SF blew me away with how well-designed all the coffeeshops are, but this one was my number one. Just come in and feel gorgeous.
author: Nancy H.

description: I love this cafe! The staff is so friendly and they always play great music. Also a great area for people watching!! The coffee and food are delicious. 5 stars all around
author: Anna W.

description: Good coffee. Great interior, though hard to find anywhere to sit. Parklet outside right next to it has a good view of neighborhood.
author: Albert N.

description:
COFFEE = 2 stars
For a place with 'coffee' in the name, I expected more than one type of coffee.  All I wanted was a cup of coffee, served black.  Call me a purist.  They have one option.  It was good, but nothing special.  I honestly didn't think it was any better than coffee served at a diner.

I'm bumping it up to a 3 star "A-OK" because I did like that the volume on the music was appropriate.  I was able to have a conversation with my friend.
author: Chloe M.

description: atmosphere unlike any other place. great spot to hang out and relax while enjoying a delicious cup of coffee. prices are reasonable and very worth it for the quality.
author: Francisco M.

description: I can't speak more highly about this cafe. The staff are friendly, helpful and skilled. They play awesome music. The coffee is consistently excellent, including bang on latte art. Service is fast, though morning lines can get long. The food is incredible and much higher quality than you'd expect for a place that's primarily know for coffee. Their breakfast items are all very good, arguably better than many primarily breakfast focused spots. They have very fast and reliable wifi. Excellent natural light comes in from the cafe's big windows. The cafe is also located in a busy area making for an interesting place to sit and hang out. There's also a "parklet" right outside if you want some nice outdoor seating. Overall, Réveille on Columbus is one of my absolute favourite cafes in San Francisco.
author: Eric A.

description: This was just what I needed. It was all so simple and easy to understand the menu. The cold brew was perfect. It was just down the street from the city lights book store which is just kinda perfect for coffee/book people. down side is that city lights doesn't let you bring it inside but uk whatever. Great coffee!
author: Becca L.

description:
Cute little cafe right on a corner on the edge of Little Italy/China Town. Perfect spot for people watching while sipping a great cup of Latte. But, if you're like me and here for work, well you might not be so happy. The internet was painfully slow, it was impossible to get work done. I'm not sure if they had a connection problem that specific day I was there or not, it just was wayyy too slow. 

Latte gets 5 stars, wifi gets 2!
author: Tamara S.

description: Excellent coffee, and the one time I popped in the server gave a coffee on the house after hearing that I had just spilled my previous morning coffee all over myself and my laptop- her kindness and the coffee made my morning!
author: E E.

description: This is a chill spot for working or having coffee. There are huge windows from which to watch passersby, 2 tables and outdoor seating. Food is very good. I recommend the quinoa salad and chia pudding. Service is great. House made cookies are nice. I'll return to try more brunch and lunch options.
author: Carol W.

description: I love the outside seating. Its definitely a study zone where you can grab coffee, ginger beer and other healthy bites. Coffee is extremely real and atmospheres is cozy. My study go to cafe.
author: 海庆

description:
My usual spot for office nearby the office.

Coffee: 4.5* I usually get soy latte, its very smooth. Their coffee is tasted comparatively lighter than the others, if you prefer very strong taste, probably it's not a right place to go.

Staff: 4.5* Mostly friendly, but sometimes they may be busy, and not paying enough attention to your order.

Environment:5* I like they have indoor and outdoor seatings. Very modern and simple design, the interior allows lot of natural lights go in., Very comfy.
author: Natasha L.

description:
This shop has a beautiful interior, with a lot of open space and natural light flowing through.  However, my coffee order disappointed.  I ordered an iced latte and it came in a tiny cup (I guess this is a norm in SF?) and the drink itself was way too milky.  I realize a latte has a decent amount of milk, but it shouldn't be so much that it overpowers any resemblance of a coffee drink.  In my opinion, a little pricey for a not-so-good drink.

Egg toast looks pretty cool though.
author: Jeff T.

description: This was a nice place to sit for an afternoon with a laptop (there's wifi and power), though the place did fill up so seating could be an issue. My matcha latte was pretty good, at a steep nearly-$6. The interior does have a nice ambiance with natural light coming in. Too bad it closed at 5pm despite being advertised as open till 6. Would come back if I'm nearby!
author: Kathy L.

description: Very modern addition to north beach with tasty treats and a well designed location. Lots of people using it as a study location while the coffee is pretty good. Overall a great place for a mid-day coffee on a sunny SF afternoon or early morning if you live or are in the area. Recommended.
author: Mike I.

description: Great Little Coffee shop. Stopped off to charge my phone, ordered an Americano. Baristas were super chill.
author: Payden A.

description:
Love love the ambiance and all the natural light! I also love the bar tables set along the windows, because they're so perfect for people watching ;) There are also outlets scattered along the wall, so I guess you could do some work between the people watching. 

Coffee here is solid. It's bold and strong and reasonably priced. 

Minus one star because the food here is just expensive and mediocre. At the recommendation of the barista, I tried the avocado toast ($4.50). The Acme bread slice was extremely thin and got a bit soggy from the avocado. Would not get it again as it really was nothing special.
author: Samantha C.

description: Such a great location to grab coffee right in the middle of the city and way from the crowd! But unfortunately the staff is incautious, they mistakenly poured on one customer's phone that was ahead of me and did not care to take responsibility. Management could be better!
author: Anny U.

description: Airy and uplifting environment and space, contemplative windows with an energetic feel, good people vibe and prompt personable service. I am not a coffee snob and only drink decaf but enjoy being in spaces such as these, not my favorite for catching up with a friend or actually working on documents, but good for stopping by to read the news or short articles. Recommend
author: Juls C.

description:
Tasty breakfast toasts with lovely latte art - great way to start the morning!

Came in before 8am and was served food and drink all within 10 minutes of showing up.  

Minimalist decor and plenty of counter space makes it seem like a good place to spend a day working as well.
author: Catherine S.

description: OK this place already had expensive coffee and I find out today when I go in if they raise the price of their coffee by $.50 which brought the total to my drip coffee for $4.38 which is just going too far it's too much money!  I used to go here kind of often but has caused me to want to never frequent this establishment again. They got rid of their frequent buyer stamp card to save money too.... I'm sure they will be fine tho and continue to rake in the cash:/
author: Chris T.

description:
Reveille is a very cute and small coffee shop. There are a couple of small tables inside , but mostly consists of counters along the walls. There are also some tables outside which give you a view of the intersection.

I really liked the taste of the cafe latte as well as the cappuccino. I also ordered the poached egg with prosciutto toast. The egg was poached perfectly. It's good for a light meal and they  were very generous with the arugula. 

The one thing that ruined the experience for me was the service. The cashier out the counter was very rude and made me feel uncomfortable as I ordered. He didn't acknowledge me at all when I came up to the counter and just stared at me as I ordered without a word. I'm used to coffee shops that have friendly baristas and cashiers and this guy was very off-putting. I wouldn't come back to this location if he's the one who interfaces with customers.
author: Sharon T.

description:
The set-up at this triangulated North Beach operation is not the most ideal as it doesn't take much to feel claustrophobic amid the United Nations delegation of tourists who congregate here on a Saturday morning. And it was indeed crazy-busy when I attempted to infuse my cold body with caffeine. It's pretty clear the Newbury brothers take their coffee quite seriously judging from the high quality of the brews. It's hard to stand out in a city already saturated with Philz and Blue Bottle shops and on the palates of the patrons who would not be caught dead at a Starbucks much less utter that name on their lips. However, they brew a fine cup well worth tasting.

The Flatiron-style building is at the intersection of Columbus, Kearny and Pacific (photo: http://bit.ly/1AbWbdR), the starting point for many a traveller looking to explore North Beach. That would be me that morning, and I ordered a $2.50 cup of Americano to prepare me for my journey (photo: http://bit.ly/16WDTSO). It was deliciously scalding but with a subtlety in the beans and gone much too soon. They serve cafe-style breakfasts like egg sandwiches and cinnamon toast, as well as salads and sandwiches for lunch. I'll return when it feels less rushed in here with the cacophony of multilingual tongues filling the small space. That's where the nearby Station SF has an advantage as you can actually lounge a bit there. Here you honestly can't wait to leave.

COFFEE - 4 stars...a smooth whisp of caffeine with a bit of a bite
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...nice modern interior but rather claustrophobic especially on a busy Saturday morning
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...no complaints about the baristas
TOTAL - 4 stars...the strength of the coffee here trumps the other aspects
author: Ed U.

description: Excellent local spot featuring outstanding coffee and a creative menu. I had a delicious cappuccino and a prociutto and avocado toast. The Mrs had an iced latte and a biscuit with jam. All excellent. Nice seating both inside and out.
author: Bill S.

description: If you are looking for a friendly coffee shop to go to in the morning as a quick stop before work, definitely DO NOT COME HERE. The baristas are extremely rude, unenthusiastic, and hate their jobs. Living in North Beach as a local for 4 years, I decided to switch it up and stop by Reveille and got the worst customer service. The barista taking my order looked like he did not want to even engage with customers, mind less take my order. Then he went on to get my order wrong. When I politely asked noted that I asked for my drink iced, the second barista making my drink responded with "it wasn't on the screen" and refused to remake my drink when clearly it was the miss on the other barista. They absolutely should not be customer facing. Their chai lattes....also a MISS. I will absolutely not be bringing any of my business back here.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Bland, pretentious, and slow. Went to this place because I didn't want the usual starbucks coffee. This  place only offers one size and still charges around $6 for a bland coffee drink. We ordered a dirty Chai and a Mocha. Both were very disappointing. We would have been better off getting coffee from the donut shop across the street.
author: Ed P.

description:
Quinoa salad yummy! Hibiscus drink delicious! 
Service, great! Person at register was very nice, warming and had opinions with my options. I like it. Thanks!
author: Denise L.

description: Terrible coffee (so sour), almost threw it away. Bathrooms weren't clean & service was so-so. Cute corner building, but probably won't be back
author: Shawna G.

description: Had a quick cold brew enjoyed a conversation and even found out that "decaf espresso" is a thing. A bit weird in my opinion but we are in San Francisco and there seems to be a trend where the weird is the norm. Anyways, if you got writer's block or just in the neighborhood, great place to charge up refresh. Ben was attentive and kind and there's a lot to be said about good customer service. humble opinion!
author: Curtis F.

description: Had an open sandwich with prosciutto, avocado, egg and rocket. Quality of the ingredients was really high. Latte was good. Worth dropping in if you're in the neighborhood
author: J.D. F.

description: It is a really great place. Very very adorable.. The iced coffee was pretty good; the avocado toast was really yummy.. What I loved the most about that place is the exterior building -- it is painted in all-black!! Literally! I was in total awe. Anyone who knows me, knows that black is my happy color; white comes in second... the interior is mostly in all white/ black/ and brass -- it felt very vintage-modern, ya know.. The little tables outside the coffee shop are in color turquoise blue.. really cute! And the pigeons came to hang out with us (probably because I was spoiling them with bits of my whole-wheat bread lol - you shouldn't do this if you hate those innocent little fellas, I swear they are so harmless and beautiful but that's just me..) and the passerby's were so friendly and down-to-earth.. I even petted a little French bulldog puppy; that puppy's parents (human parents) had just gotten engaged merely minutes after meeting me! Wow, right? I just loved how magical that place is. One of my happiest memories/ days. I will most definitely go back again someday.
author: Kristi M.

description:
Great little coffee shop located on the corner of two streets. I got a cappuccino and banana bread, both of which were delicious. The ambience definitely was my favourite part of the store: it's very well lit by natural sunlight, clean, well decorated, and had just the right amount of background noise to get work done.  

The only reason I am knocking off a star is that when I visited, the wifi wasn't functioning. Our entire table wasn't able to connect and while I wasn't working on anything that required wifi, my neighbors needed it and had to connect to hotspot.
author: Jiayi Z.

description: Great coffees and amazing burgers. The atmosphere is really nice and good for spending a quiet afternoon.
author: Mahsh I.

description: Beautiful coffee shop in a cool building.  They're not snobby like some other baristas, so they really break down that stereotype!
author: David D.

description: Lady was a huge fucking bitch. Location was cute but  I got a iced chai and it tasted like spicy water. Nasty and trash. Do not recommend went with 3 people we all got 3 different drinks and none of us liked any of them.
author: Zoe G.

description:
It's kind of refreshing to find a good coffee shop in SF that also has wifi. Not only is there wifi, but there is also decent seating, making it likely that you will find a place to work. 
The ambience is great - Reveille is located in one of the many Flat-Iron-esque buildings near Little Italy and China Town. Neutral colors and wooden bar tables are conducive to conversation and concentration. 
My only gripe with the place is that the coffee is on the bitter side. I ordered a cappuccino which came with some very average latte art on top. While decently creamy, I couldn't get past the bitterness. 
I will likely be back, seeing as how hard it is to find a good coffee shop to work in SF.
author: Mikowai A.

description: Great spot for easy coffee and food. I love working here and people watching. I would recommend the avocado toast! Great staff, very friendly.
author: Linley S.

description: Kale salad for the win!!! No turkey for me - but heard it's good with it. Coffee is strong.
author: Antigone S.

description: Cute coffee shop with plenty of counter seating and tons of natural light pouring in. It's perfect for people watching since there's big windows facing the sidewalk. It wasn't too crowded on a weekend afternoon. The service was friendly and the iced coffee ($3.50) was good!
author: Linda X.

description: Guy taking the order was rude. Girl making the coffee was slow.  They put one shot glass of espresso in my iced americano and very little ice, tastes like murky water. A hipster special for sure.
author: Chelsea K.

description:
The continuation of #jennscoffeeventures...

Réveille Coffee Co. boasts two brick and mortar locations (Castro and Chinatown) and one truck (Financial District) in the beautiful city of San Francisco. My first encounter with Réveille just so happened to be at the Chinatown location.

The space itself is unconventional, and seating can be a little tricky because there are only two tables available inside. (The rest of the seating is countertop.)  However, they've added a parklet to accommodate coffee lovers who are brave enough to face SF's violent winds.

My almond milk cappuccino was lovely. The avocado toast with fried egg was simple, but delicious.

I'll be returning, whether it be to this location, the Castro location, or even the coffee truck!
author: Jennifer K.

description:
This place was on my way home, so I figured I might as well get some work done in a new work environment. Turns out I got more work done here than I expected, so I will def be coming back here again. I sat inside facing the window (where all the other seats were facing). It was nice and sunny so that made the day even better.


Food:

I got an avocado toast with a Mocha for here. The avocado toast was good. Toast was super hard crunchy, but it def had a distinct savory taste to it. The mocha mocha here was good. Latte art on point, and lasted me until I finished my work.

Overall, the interior and food was good. Really enjoyed the vibe & environment this place has. Looking forward to more check ins here.
author: Joanne D.

description:
As I'm currently in graduate school on the East Coast, I try to do as much eating and drinking in San Francisco when I get the chance. For my one-year anniversary with my boyfriend, we made a trip back in August so he could see all that I call home. Of all the places he wanted to try in San Francisco, Reveille Coffee was on the top of his list. I really liked the vibe the last time I came by in December 2014 so I was more than willing to go again. However, due to our tight schedule and unforeseen circumstances (stupid car rental place), we were unable to stop by. :(

Even though we couldn't get to Reveille Coffee, I was determined to bring a little bit of Reveille Coffee to New Haven. I ventured on their website and was able to send an email directly to the owner(s), specifically asking if it was possible for me to purchase two bags of their whole bean coffee. Our ensuing conversation was quick, easy, and amiable. Within a few days, I was told that my coffee had been delivered and would arrive in a week (it actually arrived in 3 days!!). I was also able to pay through their payment platform which made it easy! My boyfriend is a coffee addict/lover to the max so imagine the look of surprise when he opened the package. :) The fact that the owners of Reveille Coffee were able to fulfill a special request for me made it all the more special. It doesn't hurt that the coffee tastes amazing! This really is customer service at its finest.
author: Kathy D.

description: Great latte and a great view of the Columbus tower!
author: Cynthia A.

description: Excellent tunes first thing in the morning, along with a  sunny setting on the corner of Columbus and Pacific.  Best almond croissant in the City.  The cappuccino was simply stellar.
author: Jack H.

description: The tea is great and it's a good place to get work done- not too loud or too quiet. It's bright and sunshiney.
author: Claire G.

description: Good coffee! It definitely stands up to some of the more premium coffee shops in town. So much better than any of the corporate coffee places nearby in the financial district. Lots of great big windows and natural light to sit and read. They have outdoor seating at the "parklet" out front on Kearny street. They offer almond milk for all drinks and on the bar next to the 1/2 n 1/2. Overall, a great place to sit and have a nice cappuccino.
author: Katie K.

description: Oh man, I love this place! Réveille is the perfect chic coffee shop. In addition to serving superior coffee and dishes, the staff are friendly and the space is aesthetically pleasing (I'm talking Instagram-worthy)! Réveille is my go-to for working on my laptop, meeting a friend, or for just grabbing a cup of joe when I'm out and about - and it should be your go-to, too!
author: Nicole W.

description:
Outstanding Reveille:  Coffee is appreciated here, plus their teas and their food set Reveille apart.  What a delicious kitchen!  Outdoor seating and indoor design are great.  Avocado toast and shakshuka are highlights.

Disappointing Reveille:  Service is interesting, with some great baristas and some with a heaping side of attitude.  
It can get really hot inside by afternoon, adding to the service woes as staff work for hours without even a fan.  
Kitchen is brunch only and staff is aggressive about it.  If you walk in at 1:56, your barista might have a leisurely chat with the customer in front of you for 5 minutes and then explain how the kitchen has closed 30 seconds ago and it's out of their control.
author: Eve H.

description: Like the one in the castro, they have the best iced tea. It's so good that I drink it all within like a minute and then realize that it was the quickest $3.50 I've ever spent, which makes me both resentful and makes me want another.
author: Misha T.

description:
Okay, I know I wrote in a recent review that I had one of the best almond latte's in a long time but now I change my mind (and I'll probably change my mind again, haha! I just can't make it up)

So after picking up a delicious old fashion maple donut from Happy Donuts (across the street), the group and I decided that we needed coffee to compliment our morning delight. I had Reveille before and for some reason I wasn't a huge fan. But today, today was the day that my eyes had been opened once more. 

I ordered an almond latte (surprise). It took about 15 minutes to get my drink, but it was early and there was a line and I was patient with my donut. I started to look around and I really enjoyed how they made the bar as their centerpiece of their space. You can easily watch as the baristas are steaming the milk, forming their coffee art, and even making slow pourovers, either way, it made my waiting experience quite eventful. The cafe overall is small but it's nice that they have side bar seating and small tables for people to enjoy the food and drinks. I love the open windows and their typography logo. And hey, if it's a nice day, some outdoor seating has been created recently and I think that gives this cafe an extra plus in my book.

Ah, 15 minutes pass and my coffee comes. I was really happy with the coffee art and the temperature of the coffee. The foam of the milk was perfectly light and fluffy and the espresso was surprisingly strong. The almond milk had a hint of sweetness that went really well with my donut. The latte cooled down within 15 minutes or so but it remained amazingly delicious. I would have to say that this is one of the best almond latte's I've had (for now). Yay!

Update: the next day
Had their $2.50 drip coffee! The cup is extremely hot so it was too hot for me to even consume! But then it hit me.... I didn't love Reveille too much before because I felt their drip had a sour tang. I commend them for having a strong light roast, but the tang is a no no for me. Going to add some non-dairy next time.
author: Linda K.

description: A quaint but busy coffee shop at the corner straddling the cusp of North Beach and China Town. Iced latte was well made and in a timely manner. I like the vibes and music of this shop, and the unique outdoor seating is a great place for people to hang out and catch up...over a delicious cup of coffee!
author: Jessica L.

description: Cute little coffee shop conveniently located where the financial district, north beach, and chinatown meet. I've enjoyed the coffee, tea (try the green tea!), and OJ here. The interior's beauty stems from its minimalism, ample sunlight, and triangle-shaped floor-plan. Bear in mind, however, that the inside is quite small, seating is scarce, and the ample sunlight often leads to a very toasty interior. My friends and I often times end up having to sit outside, which in stark contrast, can get quite chilly.
author: Dalia Y.

description:
Very bad wifi, unreliable. Especially for the prices and the branding. The environment is really nice as is the outdoor seating and the view. The outdoor seating gets cold when outside in the shade.
The coffee is meh, bad for its price.
author: Tomás A.

description:
Finally, a really good coffee shop has arrived in Chinatown; well, not really in the heart of Chinatown. But the newest coffee shop is located on the borderline of Chinatown and North Beach on Columbus Ave and located across the street from the iconic dive bar: "Mr. Bing's".

I was here one rainy morning on my way to work. I have decided to switch from my usual frugal and bitter coffee and gourmet cocktail bun from the bakeries in Chinatown and upgrade into a lavish espresso beverage that I can enjoy for once. 

For my debut, I ordered a latte. For $3.25, the barista uses their own brand of ground coffee bean into a "sick ass" espresso machine and add two shots of espresso into the cup. The barista also added steamed organic milk for the foam and a decorative creamy top. 

For another $3.25, I also bought a delicious coffee cake. The coffee has a crumbly and sugary topping with a moist interior. Notwithstanding that I was dealing with the heavy rain, I still put a sunshine smile when I enjoyed my latte and pastry. My treat: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cQfRu22j4nAuycKWHexAIA?select=coBRhhIuI2FDFJ8PTzabaQ#xf1ZWcjZK6zDWW-cPPF6ZA

Despite having coffee shops up the hill in the heart of North Beach and competition with other local coffee company such as Blue Bottle, Philz, Four-Barrel, Rituals and others, this coffee shop has no competition in this part of the city.
author: Matt G.

description:
With their wooden floors, open kitchen, black high stools and having an ipad to act like a register, this is a modern touch to cafe shops.

However, for a modern cafe shop, they don't have Wi-Fi.  A major let down!  I can't get my stuff on my laptop done here!

I also disliked how their high stools do not have back comfort!  I had to sit straight and felt stiff, like a hardcover book, the entire time while trying to chill and sip on my cup of coffee.

A bit on the pricey side for their coffee, but the plus is that they decorate their coffee on top.

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cQfRu22j4nAuycKWHexAIA?select=DBMSJ-N426cyKJHE-qWfRw#DBMSJ-N426cyKJHE-qWfRw

Final say - There are too many coffee shops in this vicinity up for competition with this one!  I prefer going to the ones next door or across the street just because both of those coffee shops have Wi-Fi and relaxing back support seats.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Love, love, love this coffee shop! It has the perfect cozy atmosphere to make you feel right at home.

My boyfriend and I came here for breakfast and coffee while we were in the city and were truly pleased! The lattes were delicious and I was pleased with their breakfast offering. 

The indoor area is really cute and would be a great place to get some work done, and they also have some nice outdoor seating!
author: Caroline G.

description: Great coffee. Cool ambiance. Only complaint - usually pretty busy and seating limited. Otherwise, it's great and wifi is super quick.
author: Kieran B.

description:
A bright, aesthetically pleasing space with mostly counter seating and a couple of small tables.  The noise level is usually at a good level with energetic but not headache-inducing music at a lower volume which creates a pleasant vibe. Great space to get some work done. The workers are polite and efficient with no pretentious attitude. On warmer days, It can get really hot inside the cafe though - all the windows with sun streaming in and it gets a bit stuffy. A little air would be nice. :)

One odd thing that I noticed recently is that the same drink costs different prices on different days.  It's not a big difference (about 25 cents) but it is a little strange.
author: whatever I.

description:
With the Réveille coffee truck being closed for the holidays, I'm glad we stumbled across the brick and mortar cafe instead. Réveille definitely has one of the cooler spaces for a coffee shop that I've visited. It's literally located at a big intersection on the corner of Kearny and Columbus. The cafe itself has a rotunda floor plan with an island counter bar smack in the middle with seats all around. There are windows on all sides of the cafe, which let in plenty of light. But enough about the architecture and the aesthetics, let's talk coffee. 

Despite two shots of espresso per latte, I just didn't get enough strong coffee flavor. There was an abundance of organic milk foam, but it was just lukewarm. The latte art design was well done. If I were to order again, I would opt for the single drip coffee. They served Rwanda Coproca single origin drip. The flavor was distinct, but not too bold with just a subtle hint of acidity.
author: Bailey Z.

description: In the middle of this Chinatown/Downtown/North Beach intersection-madness sits this oasis with good coffee, good service, good space, and good wifi. On the East side of Reveille, there's an outdoor public sitting space for those nice days where you just need to spend some time outside.
author: Loretta C.

description: I'm staying nearby and was really craving some delicious cafe food like we have at home in Sydney. Love the kale salad with turkey, avocado, radish and Parmesan. Super fresh and healthy, a nice cafe too with all round chilled vibe.
author: Courtney F.

description: Came here on a Saturday afternoon after a trip around Chinatown. The place is a really interesting shape, but overall quite a nice place. Had a soy chai latte, which was pretty average -- nothing spectacular, but as how one would expect a typical chai. There's some seating options on the side of the street, and overall not a bad place to work (would look for outletted seats before just choosing to settle down anywhere).
author: Cindy N.

description:
Reveil is my go to coffee place in the weekend. 

The staff is SO friendly and knows their coffee shit. You walk tell them what you're in the mood for and they brew you something. 
It's also a great place to stare at people through the big windows. 

I absolutely love this place, it never disappointed me.
author: Judith S.

description:
Dropped by in the morning for a coffee fix the week before the stupidbowl hit.
This is a fairly well regarded neighborhood coffee location in a city which is famous for it's superb coffee.
The inside is bright, well laid out and welcoming if not plush. There's no big comfy chairs but the counter seating has a wonderful street view and there's little tables tucked in for more intimate seating.
The coffee on order is most awesome. The espresso, drip coffee and latte's are all good verging on great. 
There are the usual range of croissant and pastry options, and a limited selection of breakfast items (San Francisco what is the deal with avocado toast? Is it required by law  for every coffee place to offer it?) I thoroughly enjoyed my almond pastry but it might not be for everyone. It was  crispy on the bottom and chewy in the middle, almost soft. While I enjoyed the difference of textures and mouth feel I could see where another person may want a more consistent product.
The service was a little spotty. Two people were not quite enough to service a four person deep line in the morning. 
Four stars for the near perfect latte and the view.
author: Steven W.

description: Great venue and great coffee. The space has amazing lighting, full of people working away or just hanging out and socializing. There is both indoor and outdoor seating, where you have the perfect view for people watching. The coffees are strong and delicious. Sitting here on a sunny day, while enjoying a cappuccino is simply perfect.
author: Aletta B.

description:
Beautiful place , beautiful patio , taste of coffee is okay and i like it . However , please ! @Managers , put wood mixers instead of steel spoons . Because I dont feel clean with steel spoon in a coffee place . I would love to come back everyday If you do so. 


Thanks !
author: Jay M.

description: Reveille has been on my to try list ever since I saw it when I hit up The Station awhile back.  Greg and I walked from our house (down by the ball park) to Reveille for a nice Sunday stroll and rewarded ourselves with a pour over and an iced coffee.  My Colombian bean pour over was fruity and aromatic, and it seriously hit the spot.  Greg, having now tried a number of iced coffee variations, put Reveille's version in the same hemisphere as Sightglass, albeit an itty bitty sized coffee.  If it weren't for me and dieting, some of the menu items looked absolutely delightful (yes, I'll admit to being that person who's OK with spending $4.50 on the peanut butter + jelly toast).  I can't wait to come back, the scene (and the little sitting area outside) is definitely my jam...pun intended!
author: Lisa I.

description:
I love coming here because it makes me feel both hipster and trendy. (Sometimes I feel the need to pretend I belong) Your beverage is prepared by cool hipsters, and you know its gotta be trendy because there is a Castro location!

Honestly, I can't tell the difference between their coffee and the Blue Bottle stuff served next door @ the Station, but it is delicious and the neighborhood is awesome. I've had both coffee & lattes, never disappointing. The breakfast sandwich is $9-10 so the food might seem a wee bit pricey if you aren't a tech schmillionaire.
author: Roger L.

description: SF has rare hot days and when I got here I was in the middle of one of them. However I solve this by having a nice cold brew. If you stay inside it's pretty muggy but the slanted outside sidewalk seating is nice. It's also great for people watching.
author: Kim N.

description:
This is your little cafe at the 'spot light' corner - it's situated at the edge of a triangular block and its door opens at the tip.

Interestingly, this cafe is at the very border of old-school Chinatown but within walking distance from FiDi to serve the suits and ties yuppies from there. I personally love finding those little shops or cafes that seem somehow a little out-of-place - a bit of deviation from norm can be a refreshing experience, n'est-ce pas?

It was easy to tell that most of the customers are regulars. Latte is on the more milky side. Coffee quality solid.

Almond-shaped coffee house. Wooden counters and stools lined up around the windows. A round espresso bar (and a very friendly barista) at center of the cafe. Natural lighting. Simply pleasant atmosphere.
author: Annie L.

description:
Great coffee and atmosphere. If you are in the area or even just passing through, stop and grab a latte here. The vanilla is delicious, but honestly these beans don't need it. 

They of course have food - including the obligatory avocado toast - but you know damn well that what you really want are the donuts across the street.
author: Rob H.

description:
A coffee shop with a very modern vibe, black-and-white interior, wooden floors, high stools, large windows, and hipster-ish waitstaff (who are very nice)

Oh, and fast wifi. The wifi password is also fairly funny, and aptly appropriate.

A good, clean place to chill and grab a cup of coffee. The great location doesn't hurt either.
author: Henry L.

description:
Love this place!  Cozy and friendly staffs.  They have couple outdoor seating which is great for sunny days.

Love the latte there. Very smooth and rich.  My friend tried the mocha and she said it was very good too.
author: Liza T.

description:
