I pass by this place every day as I walk to my new workplace. The cafe is bright, clean, and simple. When I came in to grab a cup of coffee with my coworkers, the experience and product didn't really meet what I was expecting from what seemed like such an inviting place. 

My coworker as really craving their biscuit and after she paid for her order and was waiting, she was approached by staff who said they were out of biscuits. She substituted her order for the French toast, but it would've been nice to have a heads up before paying.

I ordered a chai latte with a shot of espresso - a "Dirty Chai" if you will. $4 for the chai, $1.50 for the added shot of espresso and I added $1 for tip which came to a total of $6.50 for my drink. UGH WHY DID I COME HERE.

The barista made me a latte at first but the cashier noticed my confusion and they fixed my drink order. All the while they were joking about dirty chais which made me feel awkward waiting for them to make my.... dirty chai. I wish I knew they don't sweeten their drinks bc I hadn't tasted my drink until I was back at the office. I guess no sweetener is the healthier to go.

The workers at The Station across the street are much friendlier and the drinks are priced more reasonably so that is where I'll be going to get my Chai from here on out.
author: Bonnie S.

description:
I enjoyed my soy mocha here. 

Multiple pluses for this cafe! 
1. They have a clean restroom. 
2. They have good wifi. 
3.  They have outlets. 
4. They have large tables for when you gotta study hard. 
5. You can stay for as long as you want. 

I loved studying at this cafe and would totally come again the next time I'm home :)
author: Kayla O.

description: Used to go here for my caffeine fix before my shift at Quince. Very friendly staff and the iced coffee gets the job done.
author: Marie P.

description: Just had their cold brew yesterday and it was delicious. There was no sour bite to it; mainly smooth with a soft rush through. I did add some half & half to add some creamy texture to it (a splash). This place never fails with their coffees and service. Always a great stop for coffee whenever I'm in the city.
author: Allister D.

description:
I'm not a coffee drinker but I heard great things about the breakfast here so I needed to try it out.  I got the egg sandwich with bacon and it did not disappoint.  My wife got the yogurt and granola.  Both were simple but oh so tasty.

We'll be back.
author: Blake B.

description:
Pros: Cappuccino and Macchiato were good

Cons: charge you $1.99 for having your coffee at their location without telling you. A "for here" charge.  If that was the case, I wouldn't have tipped! 
Unheard of at a Coffeehouse.  At least tell your customers...!

Proof is in the e-receipt screenshot....
author: Jeff P.

description: Just great and fresh coffee, it is just a great cofe that it does not need any flavors or sugars. For sure recommended!
author: Custo A.

description:
Great little spot for a morning cuppa. 

Good lattes and by the looks of it, a pretty good hot food selection too. I've only had the cold pastries, which I'd assume are brought in. 

Interesting circular layout and refreshing decor, light and airy, which is nice to have in the morning. A lot of natural light as well. Outdoor seating is also available.
author: Andrew C.

description:
Nice location and ambiance but:

They need to fix their flaky internet! It's really annoying when you go for internet and it's down for just that day. 

The coffee here tends to taste sour for some reason.
author: Jessica K.

description:
Very good coffee...nice blend from columbia ethiopia and ruwanda...good skills...very very nice interior! !!
The bar is designed well!!!
Thumbs up!!!
author: Moritz W.

description:
The shop looked really modern and seemed like a place where you can get work done. However, you don't always get wifi, depend on where you sit and how many ppl are using it.
The latte I got was really delicious and so was the sandwich, however, it's a bit on the dry side.
author: Mark Y.

description: Great coffee, but bad food. We had two egg dishes and the eggs were heavily undercooked. The ingredients tasted cheap and the flavor was bland. The girl giving us the food was rude.
author: Captain B.

description: the interior reminds me of La Colombe locations in NYC (this is a good thing :) )- bright, airy, high ceilings with the coffee "bar" in the center of the cafe. i tried their house roast, black, and thought it was decent. the line moves quickly in the morning, looks like mostly people on their way to work, and the cafe is fairly quiet. there's some seating along the perimeter if you want to sit for a few with your coffee.
author: Meryam B.

description: It was a spur of the moment call to stop here but I'm glad we did. We got 2 cappuccinos - one with whole milk and one with almond milk. Everything was great, except the drinks could have been a bit warmer. The whole place is cute though, and a great spot for people watching.
author: Renee P.

description: When I arrived to San Francisco from Los Angeles, first thing I planned to do was stop at a few coffee shops. I did my fair view of research and Reveille was my first stop. First off great ambience, really cool setup. The chick at the counter looked like she was forced to ask you how your day was. Got my mocha to go, and as for that I'd give it a 2/5. Something was missing. Felt watery. Eh.
author: Fatima A.

description: Great coffee of the well-curated variety.  Think:  3D wave coffee served on clean and white surfaces rather than the typical North Beach "great coffee" of the type Kerouac drank.  The cappuccinos go a little toward the milky.  The seating can be tight, as one of the draws of the location (the cool triangular shape) also messes with how you can maneuver around the place.  I like the outside tables, though you want to be careful of your coffee on the tables that have to balance on the steep hill of Kearny.  There's a cleverly-designed outdoor parklet, but wow it can get windy and cold there.  Nice place to hang out with a book and watch the people on Columbus.
author: George G.

description: First, I really like their coffee, but that is a matter of taste. I also like their food-fresh, tasty and quick. I come to San Fran a few times a month and this has become my regular stop, but not for long. What they can't seem to accomplish is to get my coffee up before I get my food,  then wait while I hope my coffee gets ready, wait some more until my egg gets cold, decide to go ahead and eat, finish eating and clean up my dishes...still waiting for a cappuccino. This has now happened the last three times I visited, at 7 AM and generally only 5 or 6 customers in the place. While I appreciate the attention to detail, the pace has to pick up just a bit. The kitchen is holding up their end of the deal...maybe I'll just stick with buying a bag of beans to grind at home, because visiting is starting to get annoying.
author: Dan V.

description: Loved this place. Great atmosphere and beautiful avocado on toast. I love wish that more places would have such delicious, simple dishes.
author: Rachel B.

description:
Great coffee place!  I Love the lattes here.  This is a great alternative to Blue Bottle (my personal favorite), plus the line here is much shorter then Blue Bottle.  They have some backed goods up front for sale, and during the week have meals, but on the weekend, when the kitchen is closed, they let you bring your own food in. Plus they have ceramic cups for people who stay there, even if it is at they outside seating area.  I personally like this because it feels more like at home with a ceramic cup over a paper cup. 

They offer free wi-fi and they have plenty of seat, which makes this a great place to get your work/study done at.  There are a ton of windows the let a lot of natural sunlight in, but because of that it can get a little warm and stuffy.
author: Rose Z.

description: Came here after lunch in North Beach - the ambiance is great. Lots of natural light, big windows, and good coffee. I had the chai latte and it was delicious. Came with my laptop to get some work done and the wifi was super fast. Great experience!
author: Wei W.

description:
3.5 review.

Perfectly nice cafe in a great location on Broadway/Columbus intersection. Pro-tip: perfect Insta-moment if you look directly out the window.

The cafe itself is bright and lovely, I love the modern touches, and they have almond and soy milk options available. I've been on quite a cold brew kick lately and I have to say that I was a little disappointed by theirs. It has the tell-tale sourness of too much acidity that can get in the coffee, which I tend to dislike. In a city full of third-wave coffee options, I think Reveille is trendy but not the best.

Their food options seem quite abundant though, and they do have lots of pastry and sandwich options if you're looking for a light lunch.

Free wifi available and lots of counter seating.
author: Kate M.

description: This place is tied for my favorite place in SF to get an Almond Cappuccino! It's flavorful, smooth and uplifting. The vibe at this location is very hip and busy. Their chocolate chip cookie is also very delectable.
author: Oscar C.

description: I had the cold brew iced coffee to stay and it was great.  I'd definitely go back there later on my trip, worth the stop in north beach.
author: Brad H.

description:
I think I come here mainly because I love the interior lighting so much. It's at one of those 5-way intersections so depending on which edge of the cafe you sit, you can get a great view of eccentric SF and the tourists that walk by on a daily basis. 

No Wifi but their coffee is good. They close relatively early (5/6) but are open usually an hour later than the Station across the street so that is a plus.
author: Audrey C.

description:
Reveille Coffee does drip coffee (3.75) with a four minute wait.

menu: breakfast (toast, granola) lunch (sammies, baguettes), expressos

pour: rwanda coc.....(sm. 2)
-smooth, mellow medium roast, probably organic
-great coffee as standard cup.

drips:
-reviews mention no wifi here
-mostly stool seating next to windows
-no decor, glass all around, good window watching.
author: Victor G.

description: Four overlapping pokestops actively loaded with lures make a compelling argument to drop in for lunch. Unsure whether Reveille is leveraging their convenient location for trending ARG by loading lures throughout the day, smart play if so.
author: David G.

description: I got the mocha coffee w Soy milk. They use mocha powder and mix it with the espresso before pouring it into the cup of Soy milk and ice.  The barista didn't mix the powder well because there was chunks of powder in my drink. Treated very grainy at first until I realized it was powder that hadn't melted in the espresso
author: Jessica L.

description: This cute little corner coffee shop is so pretty! Very well designed, and very ~cool~. The baristas helped me with my selection by making a quad espresso so as to attempt a heavier roast in opposition to their selection of more floral/fruity/acidic coffees on pour. I appreciated the attempt, and my friends liked their drinks, so I think four stars is a good rating.
author: Jacob S.

description: My partner and I frequent this place a lot during the weekends. The place is right located around the corner. Like the decoration and Windows all around.  A nice spot for people watching and maybe bring your laptop/ work on your coding ?:)
author: Alanda B.

description:
I really loved the vibe here. The people were down-to-earth and friendly, and the food was really really good. I had a breakfast sammie with egg, avocado, and cheese; I also had a choco chip cookie (yum!) and a cappuccino.

There's not much I can say about this place except you should visit if you can. It's a great spot to spend part of your afternoon or morning.
author: Kim S.

description:
The Reigning North Beach Latte.

Have attempted to frequent as many of the cafés in North Beach as I can, and Reveille is in the highest tier, edging out Greco and Beacon by a subtle but perceptible margin. These people live and breathe espresso, and it's clearly of a finer quality than their competition. Smooth, flavorful, exquisite. 

Go!
author: Bosie M.

description:
What an amazing little coffee shop! I got my usual soy latte, but I have yet to come back and try their pour over coffees. The people here are also really nice, the cafe is really big so you can bring some work and sit in the corner, and it's in a great location to people watch! 

I also ordered their turkey brie sandwich and it's amazing. Delicious buttery brie with arugula and healthy turkey on a delicious baguette. They only make a set amount everyday so when they sell out you can't buy anymore, so make sure you come early!
author: Jeanette S.

description:
Reveille, deserving of its name, a pleasant "wake up call" to your morning grogginess.

With stools set up by the window that runs through the whole shop, it is an ideal and bright space for people-watching and book-reading. I love how the shop is fixated next to a low incline hill. Unlike other coffee shops, you can enjoy the seclusion of a sidewalk view without passerby awkwardly staring at you. 
For $3.5, the price is pretty average for a cappuccino compared to the many many coffee shops in North Beach. I have to admit that I was not impressed during my first 2-3 visits here because I thought their coffee was too milky bordering on bland. Recently, I frequent this place very often and have seen some improvement in flavors. It might also be because I have grown tired of the Italian dark roast and like something more bright and fruity. 

Not to mention, the staff is always personable. Let's just say, I can always depend on a good morning at Reveille.
author: Anh L.

description:
Bad attitude from the barista!!!!!
No welcoming "hi" or even look or a smile!
She treated us like we were not paying!
The coffee and food were fine, but the bad attitude just ruined our experience. 
We were really excited and looking forward for something better.
author: Meem S.

description: Wooww.. I'm disappointed!  The barista made my cappucino with leftover milk. She steamed the milk like Starbucks barista. Reveille, I think you will need to train your barista hard. No passion at all. I asked her to remake my cap but she was not pleased, I can see from her face. She made my second cap, lukewarm. I threw away before I drink it. Ruined my day. 11am 8/8/2016
author: Christophorus Y.

description:
Coffee tastes great! Although their drip coffee was unbearable,  the lattes were delicious. Their customer service is pretty bad as well. They close up their espresso machine 15 minutes to close. I had come all all the way from Napa, and my daughter came all the way from Idaho to try their coffee, but we came 15 minutes till close and we couldn't get a simple latte. This was very disspointing. So we decided to get drip coffee. This was was a big mistake. Their drip coffee was so bad, that my daughter didn't even drink it. (And she loves coffee)

About a month later we decided to give it another try, but to our surprise, the machine for decaf coffee... was Of course,  broken. Again we were disappointed, but nevertheless we decided to get a latte. When I order a latte, I typically get a 16 oz. But again, to our disappointment they only served lattes in a 12 oz cup even though they do have 16 oz cups. 

Anyway, like I said the lattes are good, but it's up to you to decide if it's worth the cons of ordering a drink there.
author: Yana M.

description:
Pretty mediocre coffee but the windows seats have a nice view of the street and pedestrians if you like people watching.

My coffee just didn't come very hot and they didn't have a great selection of beverages or snacks and food.
author: Loryn F.

description:
Beautifully designed space with excellent coffee. 

It's not designed for large groups to hang out -- it's mostly bar seating with stools. That said, it's an excellent place to work out of. It's a great place to get your creative juices going (though no wi fi). 

They don't have non-fat milk and no tea, but what they do have, they do well.
author: Victor W.

description: Yummmm.... I love the turkey and bacon sandwich. I come here quite often for lunch and I am never disappointed. They have a really good menu to choose from. Pastries are delicious as well. Best thing is they carry almond milk-when I fwel like a latte or hot chocolate, I can walk right down and get one =)
author: T A.

description: The coffee hereis solid. Even the decaf is very flavorful. They use whole, organic milk for the most part, so if you order lattes, macchiatos, or anything other than black, you're going to get some nice, creamy froth. It's fantastic. Prices are definitely $1 or so more expensive than other places, but the coffee is definitely. The only question that you have to ask yourself is - Reveille, The Station, Brioche Bakery, or any of the other local North Beach cafes nearby? They're all very good. It's just about preference. Haven't tried any of the food though, so can't say much about that. Service is great, and if you come in the afternoon, then you won't find any crowd or line. I love their window seats. Just saying.
author: Danny C.

description: Fantastic food, good coffee/tea, pleasant atmosphere and nice to our 5-year-old. Couldn't ask for much more.
author: Meredith O.

description:
Atmosphere: lots of natural light, casual, good music. 

Service: really nice baristas.. And they brought the drink near me after I already sat down. 

Drink: ordered an Americano, a staple. And they delivered. 

Price: average. 

4 = good purchase. I would probably come back here if I'm in the area.
author: Alvin A.

description:
I really like reveille. It's one of the few coffee shops in the china town/downtown area that's central, cute, and serves tasty breakfast sandwiches. And easy to find a seat if you're willing to sit outdoors. Just not that most of the seats are in fact outdoors. Perfect for a nice day. 

But beware the teas are steeped real time and take 5-8 min so don't order if you're in a rush!
I was pleasantly surprised by how filling my bacon egg cheese was as well!
author: Kaego R.

description:
Having enjoyed coffee from their truck I was excited to see Reveille open up a coffee shop.  

I normally get a Cappuccino and for the most part they do a good job.  Once however,  when I had my cappuccino in the cafe, there was a bit more milk than i would like so it kind of turned into a latte.  Another time the shot pulled was a bit acidic so it wasn't as smooth as i've had it previously.  A friend have suggested that we should only go when the two brothers (owners) are there as they make a more consistent cup and they know what up.  

I've also tried their Egg Sandwich, with Bacon and Kale.  Which, along with the inconsistencies why i'm dropping it a star from a full 5.  The sandwich was pretty good. It looks cool since it was "egg in a basket" but the $3 extra i paid for the Bacon and Kale was a little too much seeing that it was a ton of kale and what amounts to roughly 1 slice of bacon broken into 3 pieces.  Needless to say I was slightly disappointed on that front.

I do enjoy the minimalist design of the interior and love the center island coffee bar.  The metal beams that are both structural and decorative. Extremely hipster trendy.  I want to say that there is seating upstairs for people who plan on staying longer (i've only seen people upstairs from the outside), but i'm not sure.  The downstairs counter seating is good for people coming in and out for 30 mins to enjoy a cup of coffee, people watch or have quick conversation.  The high traffic around the island makes it not feel like a sit down for hours type of room.  

I work around Jackson Square and come out to church in Chinatown on Sundays and for the longest time my friends and I've been looking for a good coffee shop to enjoy a cup on Sunday afternoon.  With The Station literally across the street, coffee patrons around the North Beach/Chinatown/FiDi area can now enjoy either Four Barrel (Reveille) or Blue Bottle (The Station SF) coffee on the corner of Columbus, Pacific and Kearny.
author: Donald M.

description: Great atmosphere, reasonable prices, tasty food. Good selection of breakfast/lunch/snack items. I had the breakfast sandwich, and it was probably the best breakfast sandwich I've ever had. It was simple and well made. My friend had a slice of avocado toast and a chia seed bowl, which I thought was a little expensive at $8 a bowl.
author: Chantal T.

description: Was on a trip in SF and wanted to try all the local coffee places. My hotel was near so I walked here and it was everything I wanted! Very fast, kind service. The interior was very modern, coffee was great.
author: Esther P.

description:
Lost a star. Bummer. The main reason has nothing to do with their coffee. It's their sea salt chocolate chip cookie. While still very large, it's far inferior to the way it used to be. It now has only lots of tiny flakes of chocolate - no larger chunks like it once had along with the flakes. And, my most recent cookie was quite dry - sandy almost - and the sea salt on top was in a large clump in the center. That's not palatable. I'm not doing tequila shots - the salt should be a light sprinkling all over the top so every nibble has some. Something has changed with their baking supplier - a new employee, or?

Also, I don't think the barista was told of my drink by the cashier. The barista was super friendly - with one of the best smiles I've ever seen -  but she had to deduce that I was waiting for a drink (and asked me) instead of knowing about it via the cashier. Minor stuff. Great coffee.
author: Lauren C.

description: Great coffee tea and pastries, nice people, great atmosphere, really nice parklet, what more could you ask for?
author: Larisa M.

description: Nipped in for a quick cup to rest our tired feet. We had chai latte (with almond milk) and a regular latte. Compared to other establishments like Philz Coffee, theirs was forgettable--but decent. Ambience was chill, relaxed, minimal. Good place to read a book / get some work done.
author: Shannon E.

description:
Rude service. The barista(the red head)  was incredibly rude, and despite having reminded her nicely for my drink (which she had forgotten to make), made it with a lot of attitude (like she was doing me a favor). I get that coffee shops can get customers who are difficult, but maybe you don't take it out on the ones that are nice to you.
Oh - and the espresso was lousy.
author: Parth B.

description: Love the coffee and their art cute out side you will forget this is part of China town. Beautiful clean setting. Very calm and relaxing in the city . Urban oasis here gotta love it ! Cup of tea and coffee . You feel little peace .
author: Yuri N.

description: Great coffee at a quaint location, facing the iconic Columbus tower. Nice modern decor.
author: Christopher K.

description:
First off, this is not in Chinatown. It is North Beach. Sure the Chinese would like to claim it, but it is still (holding on tightly) in North Beach. For me, the location is great. It has good views and excellent people watching with plenty of outdoor seating. The staff is wonderful. Smiling beautiful women abound. There is one thing off for me: the coffee. I just don't like it. Maybe I am accustomed to Peet's, I don't know. However, I am sure many people will like it. My friend who I go with, thinks it is top-notch
 I will still go because all the pluses outweigh the minuses. It would be so nice if I could bring my own home brew here.
author: S. G.

description: This is totally my kind of coffee shop. I love that the building is black. When it comes to coffee shops, one big thing for me is natural light... and this is place surrounded by windows. +1. There's also a parklet just outside. +10. Outdoor seating in SF doesn't get much better than this.
author: Sawsan D.

description:
Asked my BF if we could stop by to grab a coffee after we had lunch in Chinatown, and he bought me my latte! =D

Reveille is very close to Chinatown and located on an interesting corner. I liked the interior with the very big windows that allowed you to look out and enjoy the scenery. Definitely a good place to people watch, chat with a friend or just chill with a good book while nursing your coffee. The lady at the register was really nice and happily prepared my iced soy latte which tasted a lot better than your average chain coffee. They don't add sugar but there is simple syrup and lids for the cups in the back.

This coffee joint is cute but it's pricey and a bit out of the way for me. If I'm in the area I may swing by, but I think the charm of this place is best appreciated if you stay and sit awhile.
author: Sam F.

description: Ok coffee. The truck is too high for a short person (5' 1") like me to reach to sign and pick up the coffee. The ladies managing the truck didn't bother at all that I couldn't sign. She just turned around and upon requesting signed on the iPad herself. Weird. Didn't even bother getting the coffee to me. First time I have experienced something like this.
author: Divya K.

description:
At many a strong-coffee outpost in this city, I feel like I'm putting the counter staff through some sort of unfair test when I ask for a cup of tea. It felt like that at Reveille, but I liked it here just the same. 

"Of course we have tea," he assured me when the posted menu did not, but he wasn't sure what kind. 

I made it easy on him: "Anything herbal, like peppermint or chamomile," I coached him. 

He offered an unsure smile and set out to find the tea. "Herbal Medley?" he asked, holding up a several-pound sealed bag he had ransacked the cabinet to locate. 

It was delicious, and he served it on a bamboo tray in a fine little glass press that didn't smell at all like coffee. I took all it outside and sat in the delightful adjacent parklet to write in the sunshine. Perfecto!

It looks like a posh assortment of pastries and plenty of indoor seating too. I'll be back.
author: Kristy L.

description:
Wow I've been coming here every day on my way to work to grab a cup of coffee in the morning.  I tend to bring my own thermos as not to waste their paper cups.  This is the first time a barista has ever measured out a 12oz of coffee in a paper cup then poured it into my thermos.. .WOW.  Thanks for wasting a paper cup I was trying to save AND make me feel like   I'm trying to be cheap by bringing in my own thermos.  

I am so appalled I may never go back.  Put a bad start to my morning.
author: connie h.

description: I finally tried a pastry, and was not impressed. I had a giant cookie because it looked awesome and giant, but I think it was under-baked. But that won't stop me from coming because not only do I love this place for their delicious lattes, I also love this place because the guys that work there are oh, so sexy.
author: Angela L.

description:
The atmosphere and presentation of the place is good, but the coffee is absolute rubbish. I bought a cappuccino which was so awful, I couldn't drink it & so I took it back. Got some attitude from the guy taking the order and was then presented with fresh cup of luke-warm, sour tasting garbage. 
Don't go if you like good coffee.
author: Ash S.

description:
I guess I'm not sure how I should approach a review of Réveille, if you like over priced, hipster, fair trade hand dripped coffee than this is a great spot. 
If you are perfectly comfortable in a Starbucks,  than I don't see what all the fuss is about. 
The location is killer though. Right at the foot of Columbus.
author: Jack W.

description: Always a beautiful espresso.  I sometimes have to have a second right after the first, it's so good.  Always a nice atmosphere. Great to sit in the window, and watch the world go by, or get too involved in your book. A classic cafe where nearly the whole place is a window to the world.
author: Mark S.

description:
I had not written a review in yelp since 2007 but I have to say that I just had the best breakfast sandwich i've ever had in my life! Its a gem! Simple but delicious...Kale, melted gruyer, bacon and one egg sitting on top! I recommend splitting it down the middle and let some of that egg white and yolk drip and soak into the sandwich. 

Heads up, it takes a while to make so I if you are in a hurry probably not a good idea to order it. Also it should be ingested slowly enjoying each bite, not like your regular egg muffin or bagel. This took some time to make so take your time savoring it.

FYI the coffee is pretty good too. Its no blue bottle but definitely a righteous competitor.

This new option on yelp that allows me to write a review from my phone is pretty cool.
author: Hector S.

description: I've come here a few times before and have had better experiences. This morning, having gotten avo toast with an egg, I was excited to settle in for a productive morning. Unfortunately, they have no wi-fi, which means getting any work done will be tough. They also took 18 minutes to bring out my toast (the little sign with your order number also records the order time), which was both cold and burnt. I'm not going to give it two stars because the coffee is usually good, but seriously Réveille, step up your game - there are too many alternatives for you to compete with.
author: Katie G.

description:
Oh my goodness, awesome. Really great coffee, beautifully made, right temperature, extraction, lovely barista. Few outlets for the laptop huggers, big windows that let in natural light.

Love the simplicity of the place. Clean wooden decor, spacious layout, centered service area, you're instantly seen and greeted by the staff. Even the menu board hanging above is straightforward with just its core offering - coffee.

It even has a nice comfy out door area (benches) with seatings that seats large group, which is rare in the North Beach Area ( cafes there mainly have small tables that seats only 2-3).

Though I'm quite certain the ready-made Turkey & brie sandwich i got (from the counter wrapped in brown paper - marked with a T - for Turkey ) was actually Ham. 
The piece of protein i was chewing was pink, and didn't really taste like how turkey usually tastes). Luckily, I didn't offer it to my muslim friend who I was buying lunch for, and had it myself instead.
author: Lianne M.

description:
My Favorite Coffee Shop in Town

I am not a frequent reviewer but my time at Reveille Coffee shop has prompted me to write this. Walk into this coffee shop and expect to find the following:

- Friendly Staff - Especially Jamie. She's awesome
- Great coffee. 
- Impecable service 
- Beautiful service ware - cups, mugs, tea diffusers etc
- Brilliant setting - windows EVERYWHERE
- Amazing food - check out the quinoa bowl 

This spot is doing it right!
author: Jason H.

description: Fresh pastries. My husband and I ordered the pecan pie tart and shared it. Fairly expensive but it was really good. Not great, but really good.
author: Erica L.

description: The structure of the shop felt welcoming with natural lighting coming in from both sides of the shop.  The cashier and baristas were friendly, and the latte was delicious.  Plus, they made a heart on my drink.  As much as I try to hold my poker face, deep down inside, I die of happiness when baristas make pretty art on my lattes.
author: Lynn L.

description: Réveille is my go-to sit down coffee shop when I'm in the North Beach area. The inviting space is airy, cozy and filled with abundant natural light. Ample seats are lined up against large windows along two perimeter sides of the shop, allowing patrons to coffice away or people watch at leisure with great views of the surrounding neighborhood. My usual cappuccino order here has always been executed well, with impressive foam art to boot, by friendly and efficient staff.
author: Jay D.

description: This is a review for their quinoa bowl only! I was disappointed with the portion size, the amount of headliner "quinoa" in the box, and lack of flavor. The amount of quinoa sprinkled on was similar to the amount of other toppings: pumpkin seeds, acorn squash, and grilled cauliflower. The flavor for the entire salad was bland, the dressing was more oily than lemony.  Other than that, the warm environment, the compostable utensils, and large windows made this newfangled coffee shop cute and worth going back for their latte art.
author: Nancy Y.

description: Great folks-thank you for not being pretentious baristas!!! Tasty coffee, very pricey but at least it's good! The music is pretty terrible but that's what head phones are for. Really excellent location! High marks for these peeps!! Thanks!!
author: Nik H.

description:
I used to be somewhat obsessed with this place when it opened because it was the best coffee in the immediate area, but have since fell out of love with it.  The main reason is that over time they have created this atmosphere that feels a little exclusive, a little pretentious, and maybe a little unwelcoming.

The people behind the counter aren't necessarily mean, but I always get the sense that they're just being "friendly enough."  I don't know, perhaps I'm not the type of clientele they're trying to cultivate.

I would say the coffee is certainly better than The Station (next door), but in my opinion it is not better than other FiDi spots like Coffee Bar or Coffee Cultures.  It certainly is no Blue Bottle.

If you're going to go here, I actually recommend going to their truck, which is like a 2-3 minute walk away.  The coffee is still good without the weird cooler-than-thou feeling.

But really, ever since Coffee Bar opened their location on Kearny, I don't find that there is much of a reason to come here anymore.
author: Jon N.

description:
Great spot for a quick coffee, reading a book, catching up with friends, sitting in solitude, grabbing a quick bite.....Reveille has an open and airy space that can be deceiving from the front door.  Located on the corner of where Pacific, Kearny, and Columbus meet, the front door is the tip of a triangle and that tip opens up as Columbus and Kearny spread their separate ways.  When walking in, don't miss the doggy treat jar if your dog is waiting outside for you!  Excellent coffees and food menu items.  Brunch favorites include the egg sandwich with bacon & kale (add avocado and ask for it to be cooked with olive oil instead of butter for a fun twist!) and fried egg with avocado on toast (i like to add the kale and leeks to it for more of a filling brunch option).  

Reveille also has a truck just a couple blocks down on Pacific/Sansome that opens up bright and early every weekday (at least it's always there when I walk down to work around 7:30am).  The food truck has coffees and pastries for morning cravings.
author: Naomi P.

description: If I were rating this place on the quality of the food/drinks and ambiance, it would get a 5.  I could even look past the ridiculously high prices as I realize this is San Francisco and the cost of everything is ridiculous.  I cannot though look past the rudest customer service I have pretty much ever experienced. Each person I have encountered has been so unfriendly and rude that I almost feel guilty for asking for something to eat or drink.  They seem to have a new person working the register every week: Guys, something is wrong that you have such high turnover and each person is just as rude as the last and you should definitely fix it.
author: Kim W.

description:
Delicious coffee. They know what they are doing here and it shows in the espresso drinks and straight up drip coffee. 

I also love they're breakfast sandos. Eggy weggy with avocado on buttered toast? Yes! Really nice sheeps milk yogurt with granola and fruit too. 

Some of the best people watchin' in the city when seated at the window facing Columbus.  All walks of life at this crossroads of coffee, Italian food, strip clubs, techie offices and financial district thugs in their enviable attire.
author: Dusty B.

description: Nice, elegantly simple coffee house. I was a bit disappointed in the pastry selection just because I was craving something different but then the girl said to try the biscuits for breakfast and it was divine :)  - soft, flakey with jam mmmm
author: Tere C.

description:
Bad place to work or to have a  drink. 

The place close at 6pm, the kitchen close at 3:30. At 4:30pm the staff already start to clean the place. Moving chairs next to you. Mopping, cleaning the kitchen, the coffee bar, everyone around you gives you the feeling that you need to go and you disturb them and there is still at least an hour before closing!

I will never return and it's too bad because the coffee was good.
author: Shay B.

description: One of the best stops for latte and quick snack. The atmosphere is super Brooklyn-Hipster and the coffee is top notch. There's plenty of searing to relax and look out into the street, great location with he view to the Financial District, and all the tourists that pass by. Don't worry they won't come in, as those creatures only drink Dunkin Coffee for $1.75. Come on in, experience what real espresso and latte should taste like.
author: Vladimir G.

description:
Savory sweet.

Homemade granola was three stars. Rich and crunchy. Accompanied by slices of strawberries. Whole milk yogurt on the side. Bit heavy for my palette.

Homemade peanut butter was four stars. Available on toast but generously given as a sample when asked. It's a guilty pleasure. But a pleasure all the same.

Homemade salted chocolate chip cookie was five stars. Each chip came alive with the sprinkling of sale. So good. Not cheap for $3.50. Yet almost two cookies in size.

Good luck trying to save some for later.
author: Jason B.

description: came here for lunch. nice selection of made-fresh options. sandwiches come with a nice side salad. they have a hibiscus ice tea which is really nice. prices are reasonable, the space is really sunny, open and airy due to the wedge shaped layout (it sits on the corner of Columbus and Kearny) and there is outdoor seating too, but in general it's not super comfortable to eat in if you're not by yourself as there are only a few tables. the rest is counter space. staff is friendly. probably worth slightly more than 3 stars but the lack of seating lowers it a bit.
author: Bob U.

description: Really good coffee (I prefer it over blue bottle) and major perk is they don't up charge you for adding almond milk to your cold brew or drip coffee! Food is freshly made and packed with flavor (try the chicken salad sandwich or home made biscuit and jam). Their sea salt chocolate chip cookie is my guilty pleasure. Conveniently located on Columbus Ave and everyone who works there is friendly. It's my go to mid-afternoon pick me up spot! Thanks for getting me through the work day!
author: Sally S.

description: The perfect spot for an easy Saturday morning. I've been exploring North Beach coffee shops for years and this is one of my favorites. Best roasted beans for home brewing.
author: Regina G.

description:
I can pretty much guarantee that if something is brewed, it'll make my mouth oh so very happy. As such, I dutifully travel from coffee spot to coffee spot consuming the liquid magic the bean yields. 

Stopped here on Saturday afternoon. Upon walking in, my superficial self already liked this place. The design is impeccably done and feels modern and hip yet casual. I ordered my usual; a non-fat cappuccino. It was delicious and strong enough to keep me successfully operating on the 3 hours sleep from the night prior. I sat outside to enjoy the lovely bay weather. They had 2 tables and 2 benches outside if you wish to do the same. 

Yet another SF coffee treasure. Boom.
author: Kim S.

description: This is definitely one of the cutest little coffee shops around.  I love the odd triangular shape of the space with its contemporary designs and friendly hipster vibe.  It's conveniently located right in the North Beach/outskirts of Chinatown area and only a few blocks away from the Transamerica Building... perfect if you want a change from your usual Starbucks or Peets coffee.  They don't have a very extensive menu, but the few items they have are solid.  The lattes are delicious - so perfectly made and artfully presented.  Coffee - strong and definitely hits the spot, especially during that mid afternoon crash time.  They also have a nice little variety of pastries and cookies.  Yup, definitely going to become a regular here, when work permits...
author: Cecilia S.

description: Went in here got a regular coffee and a ice brew.  The girl at the counter pours the hot coffee and puts it on the counter in a manner that spills some out and doesn't even notice or apologize.  Doesn't bother to fill it to the top either.  Then she takes care of my cold ice brew that she didn't spill.  after putting in creme and sugar taste it and its SOUR.  Sour ice brewed coffee.  The person who ordered the hot coffee also said it was sour.  It is almost like they didn't even bother to try.
author: Stevezee C.

description:
I experienced Reveille Coffee Co for the first time yesterday. Everything hits you just the right way when you enter in the beautiful space- the space is bright, the roundness of the menu is perfectly approachable, and the cashier was delightfully friendly. My latte was perfectly pulled, and the chicken banh mi was super tasty. 

The ONLY thing lacking is no wifi. I would come everyday from the opposite side of the city if they had it!
author: Kelly E.

description: Nice little coffee shop, with tasty pour-over coffee. I was disappointed in their breakfast selection. Their breakfast egg & bacon sandwich ($9.50) is small, leaving you still hungry & nowhere near as good as the croissant breakfast sandwich across the street at The Station. They also didn't have orange juice, so I had to make do with an orange soda. Overall this is a great place for coffee & a pastry, but not so great for breakfast/brunch.
author: David K.

description:
Yay! Finally a coffee spot near my home AND on my way to work!

Yes, I suppose there are other cafes around this neighborhood but none that focus on quality coffee like Reveille does. I came in the first time with Danielle M. on a Sunday afternoon - they are open until 5. I ordered a soy cappuccino which was made perfectly. The prices seemed on par with the quality of coffee and service. 

There is some bar stool seating but nothing too comfortable. I wouldn't 'work from home' here. 

They do offer some food items which looked really good so I will be back to try those.
author: Sara P.

description:
Apparently this was a coffee truck that started out serving Four Barrel in the FiDi, then moved on up, to the north side, to a dee-luxe tiny little storefront, on Columbus. They finally got a peice, of the vegan gluten-free scoooooooooooone!

The place was off-putting to me at first because the design of it looks a little too Apple People for me, and the baristas looked intensely hipster from a distance. They turned out to be a couple of really nice guys though. 

Never had Four Barrel before, it's that lighter, sweeter, slightly fruitier? loamier? style that I'm not really into, but it's quality and has a good caffeine high, people who like that style will love it. It was drinkable, I didn't feel like I wasted my money. And between the strong coffee and the James Brown blasting 1st thing in the morning you'll be fully equipped to get on the scene like a sex machine.

Only real issue is that like nearly everywhere else in North Beach, you have to take out a 2nd mortgage to pay for some breakfast sweets.
author: Jeremy H.

description:
Just coffee for me but looking around looks like breakfast is good ! Good atmosphere here !
The espresso is interesting. Well roasted coffee and a unique citrus like after taste and a bit of salt ?. I would not make it my daily routine. I prefer the nutty flavors of classical italian espresso but I aporeciate the craft !
author: Olivier M.

description:
I work nearby. This place makes some decent coffee but not as good as the Station across the street. The $13 turkey sandwich with bacon is great, but it's $13. 

People have been commenting on SF's new expensive artisan toast fad. At RCC you can get a piece of toast with peanut butter & jelly for $4.50. It's that kind of place. Fried egg on toast, $4.50. 

For good food or coffee I'd suggest Brioche around the corner or the Station across the street.
author: Melville M.

description: This place is fantastic, amazing environment, great service, and the coffee lives up to the fables!
author: Drew W.

description: Super chilled out place to sit and read or work for a couple hours. The coffee beans are top notch and the baristas are really nice.
author: Ravi T.

description:
I loved this place. They have a small breaky/lunch menu and obviously coffee options. I had the chopped salad- romaine lettuce, peppered salami, hard boiled egg, provolone, cannellini bean, parsnip, carrot, and red wine vinaigrette. Great flavors & textures. Tasted very fresh & all the ingredients complimented each other well. I especially liked the little cubes of cheese & salami. Cool spot with several healthy food choices. Looking forward to going back & trying one of their sammies & the giant sea salted chocolate chip cookies I unwillingly resisted. 

For the full review please visit:
http://consumingcolumbus.blogspot.com/2013/05/reveille-coffee-co_8.html
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
Reveille is a really cool coffee shop on the edge of Chinatown and the Financial District. It's nice and spacious with tons of natural lighting. 

The baristas are nice and friendly. And they have real food. Like, real, real food for breakfast and lunch.

The quinoa salad and kale salad are SO good and fresh.

Downsides: no wifi. No chai lattes.
author: Paulina D.

description: One of my go-to coffee places since it opened. The service has always been friendly and quick when I stop by mid-morning for a coffee break. Love the latte art (and I'm a sucker for it too!). I like what they did with the open space with wood floors and large windows. Not many seats, but there haven't been many people in here when I'm here on weekdays. Good place to sit and look out on the street and get some work done.
author: Katherine S.

description:
My morning walk to work just got a little better. For the last six months I walked by the sign on the window that teased me about a new coffee shop opening up in the fall. I walked by hoping each day that that day was the day but my wish didn't come true. Of course the day that it opened I was out of town visiting my folks for Thanksgiving. Oh well. 

I was excited to walk by on Monday morning with a little extra time on my side. I stopped in and ordered a soy latte with a coffee cake. The space is nice and open and everything seems really clean. The staff was friendly enough but they all seem to have the same expression on their face as they greet you. It's as if they are wondering if you will become one of the regulars that they will get to know and befriend as time goes by or if you're just there to judge the new corner coffee shop. 

There weren't many people when I stopped by around 8:20 and my coffee was ready in about five minutes. I had never tried Four Barrel Coffee before and I must say that I liked it. I love that when it was handed to me, it was the perfect temperature for immediate imbibing. I'll have to try it some more to really get a good feel for the flavor. I walked all the way to work sipping a little while i waited at red lights. When I got to work I still had about half the latte and the whole coffee cake. I'm so glad I got that coffee cake . It looks like it has pistachios and raisins. it has a great texture and consistency. It is moist but not too buttery and complements the coffee perfectly. 

I saw they also make breakfast sandwiches. I will definitely be stopping by here again soon.
author: Daisy S.

description:
Cool space - open, airy, bright with windows all around - great for people watching.

Had the cappuccino, very interesting flavor with a nice fragrant.  It would have been great if it was hot, not sure why it was just warm since they made it to order.

Look forward to returning and trying some of the food items.
author: Gloria H.

description: I am love coffee. I've had Intelligencia in Chicago, Blackbird in Milledgeville and coffee from all around. This is the best coffee I've ever had in my life. I can't believe it. You have to go to it. I had a latte.
author: Pete K.

description:
BEST AVOCADO EGG SANDWICH EVER! That's hands down the truth.

Lucky for me I work around the corner from this place - I'm pretty sure it's just eggs over sliced avocados on toast but damn, there must be crack or something in that sandwich! It's F**KING OUT OF THIS WORLD.

ok the coffee is pretty damn good too!
author: Teresa J.

description:
i'm always on the lookout for new cafes.  this one was perfect for a rainy day of studying.  since reveille is on a corner, it gets a generous amount of natural light - yay!

i walked a little over a mile to get here, but it was worth it.  coffee wasn't particularly delicious, but it absolutely got the job done, as i was pretty jittery after half a cup.  to be fair, i did have two shots of espresso before coming, but those two shots are a necessity as a law student.  as with most cafes in the city, i only wish this one were open later.

food is pretty good, but not cheap.  if you're not too hungry, the yogurt + granola + pomegranate is filling + yummy... and i don't like yogurt that much.
author: Jennifer L.

description: I decided to take the day off work and wander around north beach. Looking for a place to charge my phone, and have a drink I wandered into Reveille. Im not much of a coffee person and it being a warm day out, I ordered an iced chai, not expecting too much...but it's absolutely great. A good mix of not being too spicy nor too sweet. I will be back!
author: Rebecca D.

description:
I am so happy Reveille opened a store.  I'm a big fan of their coffee truck, but it's a little out of the way for  me to go to all the time.  This location is perfect for those of us who walk through North Beach to work. 

Yes, their coffee is delicious.  What I wasn't expecting was for their food to be delicious too.  They've expanded their pastry selection that they serve at the truck and have added a small menu for breakfast and lunch.  I got the granola and yogurt, and it was hands down the best  granola I have ever had.  It's homemade, and has almonds, pistachios, honey, and they top it off with fresh pomegranate.  I can't wait to try the rest of the menu. 

What really sets Reveille apart from the rest is how nice the guys are that work there.  Not just polite and cordial, but actually friendly.  And they certainly aren't your average judgy hipsters that seem to work at most of the other fancy coffee shops in town.   It's 7:30am and I'm heading to work (yuck), I just got off Muni (double yuck), and I haven't had any coffee yet, so I  really appreciate it when the people at the coffee shop are friendly.    I have a feeling Reveille might become part of my morning routine.
author: Nicole G.

description:
Add these guys to the single-digit list of 5 star espresso places in the city outside of the mission.

Ok Ok Ok, I don't go to the mission for coffee so that's why I'm qualifying this. I live on the north side of market and our selection is limited to what I've counted as 5 places. 

Get the espresso. Just.....Just do it. It's a really really good shot. They have the appropriate equipment that I only wish I could afford at my apartment. They have the skills and an awesome story about how they got to where they are now.

The guys there are amazing too. Really nice, they have the ability to remember my name like no other place in the city. 

The space is gorgeous inside. A truly great espresso experience in fidi/north beach.
author: Roderic C.

description:
I must be truthful: I am a hardcore Blue Bottle latte fan. However, Reveille has quickly gotten up to my #2 spot. Their lattes are creamy, the staff/owners are super friendly, and the service is quick. This is probably why I come to Reveille more then the above mentioned. 

I also like their space and atmosphere, and even though I've only gotten lattes/food "to go", I can see myself enjoying my time sitting on those stools reminiscent of my times at Architecture Studio.

Overall thoughts: A solid, dependable, local coffee shop. I want to come here to try their lunch sometime.
author: Stephanie K.

description: Lovely spot for a light lunch. I dropped in with a friend and we ordered a few small plates of salad with yummy ingredients like farro, goat cheese, beets, and such. I wish the outside tables were a little more sturdy but otherwise, have no complaints. The floor to ceiling windows alone are worth one star!
author: Erin W.

description: Some of the best coffee in North Beach and the space is absolutely beautiful! I've tried a few of their breakfast options including the yogurt, which had fresh cranberries and homemade granola, and the egg sandwich. Both were a great start to the day! Would highly recommend!
author: Emily S.

description:
Seriously... Best Coffee... Coolest atmosphere... Great Breakfast.

They have WiFi... which many cafes in SF do not have, and the coffee and drinks are literally off the chart. I am a die hard Starbucks guy... who just started work at Google in SF and found this place. And this is my place now.

Coffee is so smooth and the guys running the shop are the same one's who have been here for the last 3-4 months which is continuity in the coffee shop world.

LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!
author: Ed L.

description: Stumbled upon this gem after a stroll through the rain with my date this past weekend. I love that this place is so simple and unpretentious. Very clean in aesthetics with white walls, black lines, and a light wood bar that looks out to the street. It's a great place to people watch and people watch I did as Santacon took over the streets of SF. So many interesting characters. Staff was very friendly and helped my date get a bag to keep his roasted beans dry while we braved the rain without an umbrella. I'm not a fancy coffee drinker so I was impressed with the coffee art. My mocha tasted great and wasn't sweet at all. I would definitely come back to hang out if I'm ever in the city again.
author: Kathy T.

description: Walk by this everyday but finally decided to give it a go. Really good food and service. Tried the Prosciutto avacado egg toast and also had a cappuccino. Both were perfect. I'll be going back very soon.
author: Mike J.

description: They have delicious coffee and a decent selection of breakfast options. We've tried the avocado toast and biscuit with jam and both are delicious. They also have friendly service and outdoor seating!
author: Hi T.

description:
Jackson Square is becoming quite the coffee lovers destination. Now with the Reveille (serving 4 barrel coffee) and the Station (serving Blue Bottle) on opposite sides of the same intersection of Pacific and Kearny, coffee lovers really are spoiled for choice. 

I like the clean layout and circular coffee bar here. Great coffee goes without saying -- I really think 4 Barrel is the best coffee on the market. At this point, it's really hard to say which of the new gourmet coffee shops I prefer. I guess I'll just have to bounce around to both. Not a bad situation to be in.
author: Johnny W.

description: Good spot with very knowledgeable barista in an area full of chains or drip coffee makers.  Great locally roasted coffee using a Kalita Wave for their pour overs.  If you're in the area, definitely stop by.
author: Austin H.

description: Reallyyyy great location and modern vibe.  I got the latte... Was alright, not the best, also not the worst. Also ordered Egg and toast with avocado, egg was perfectly cooked and very flavorful. Would go back
author: Connor B.

description:
Pro: good cappuccino.   
Cons: very bitter and unusual espresso. Tasted like vinegar. 

Nice little trendy spot, but had really hoped for a great shot of espresso. What they poured tasted like vinegar. I ended up filling the demitasse up with milk in order to be able to drink it. 

I also bought a cappuccino for someone else, it was pretty tasty.
author: Dan G.

description: It is a nice bright space to sit in, just set expectations low on the java. Hit or miss. Last time had a lousy macchiato, way under-extracted and the lowfat or steam-watered milk didn't help. For the price it's not up to standards. There are better options very close by - Chapel Hill comes to mind.
author: T B.

description: I like to run, so this morning I ran around San Francisco (as I'm visiting from Denver) and up to Réveille. It seems like a very hipster place to be. With a  sleek interior and hipster baristas, this coffee shop is great for on the go people and hipsters alike. The coffee is awesome and they have free wifi, but I noticed a bit too much milk in my latte (at least more than I enjoy) and a sort of cold environment. Everyone who came in was a hipster, businessman, or wifi seeking computer junkie, all enjoying he coffee. Would recommend a latte if you like a considerable amount of cream, but the drip coffee also looks fantastic.
author: Cole H.

description:
Personally, I love Reveille's coffee. Their Avocado Toast is phenomenal as are their chocolate chip cookies.

The reason I'm writing this (my first review ever) is due to the disappointment of them raising their prices. When I first started coming to Reveille about 6 months ago, a 12oz coffee was $2.50. Perfectly acceptable for a coffee. You could pay more for a pour-over if you wanted. Refills were $1.

Then, maybe 2 months ago, prices went up. $2.75 for a 12oz and $1.75 for refills. Still, not too too bad. I'll accept paying more than Starbucks for good coffee.

On Tuesday, I walked into this location and saw that they finally created a 16oz cup! How exciting! When I asked how much that was, they said $3.50...eh, okay, not great, but oh well. I then asked for my 12oz cup and saw that they had upped the price again (within 2 months) to $3.00. $3.00 for a 12oz cup of coffee that's from a large thermos??

Now again, I love my coffee and have no problem paying a premium for a good cup. However, Philz allows you to pick a roast and have them brew it for you right then and there charges $3 for a small and $4 for a large. The fact that Reveille is charging this price is simply disappointing, especially since it used to be $2.50 three months ago. 

I'll probably keep coming, though definitely less frequently. Jackson Place is still at $2.75 for a great pour-over, and the Philz Truck is nearby on Sansome.
author: Zack C.

description: Id say I had the best tasting cappuccino I've ever had here. Wonderful surprise as I've been to every roaster there is in the bay area and Seattle.
author: David D.

description:
- This place gives me creeps.
- Ordered at 7:50- 1 drip small and one egg sandwich. From Love child of Abercrombie & Fitch catalog model and dirty hipster.
- 7:53 - Received coffee from fore-mentioned Love child of model and hipster.
-  7:56 - Sips coffee and analyzes weird layout and strange procedures of coffee house.
- 7:58 - Wonders why albino automaton doesn't stick a hook on to a broomstick to open the goddamn windows.
- 8:00 - Feeling hungry and wants his $9 F'ing sandwich.
- 8:02 - coffee is gone.
- 8:04 - AB/Hips are staring out windows at worker bees. Looks of wide eyed eclectic fashion boredom unblinking in the bright morning sun. Freaks me out.
- 8:07 - What the fuck? Where's my Goddamn Food?
- 8:10 - Looks at 2 kitchen fools in the back furiously working on something.... Is that my sandwich? It better be amazing.
- 8:12 - I'm late for work. Someone will die.
- 8:15 - Ask the female albino robot about my egg sandwich? She tilts head in Japanese anime unnerving way and says, "It will be ready shortly.... Beep" WTF? Does she have cameras embedded in her robot hair?
-8:17 - Finally! one of the kitchen staff is bringing something ...!
-8:20 - .... He unloads 20 pre-made breakfast sandwiches into a basket at the front counter...... !!!!!!!
-8:20 1/2 - The laser beams from my eyes scorch the circuitry of the AB/Hip robots and they turn and twirl like confused iRobot vacuums stuck in a hallway.
-8:21 - I say.... "Are you serious? I've been waiting 25 minutes and you couldn't make mine first?!?!"       W.... T.... F.... !     I tipped you AF&H assholes!
8:23 - Finally a trembling member of the kitchen staff brings me my bio-degradable compostable container with half-hour egg sandwich within.... And leaves it on the counter..... I follow his head with my death vision willing his brains to explode on the walls in a bright crimson spray of revenge!
8:24 - Pick up sandwich and walk slowly out of that unnamed place that should burn to the ground.
8:25 - Walk by SF Station and see more goddamn hipster robots !! They are everywhere! They congregate like flies around excrement!
8:30 - Arrive at work half hour late and opens container. Eww... This gruyere stinks. 
8:31 - Throws sandwich into garbage in disgust. Raw ass egg! Disgusting KALE !!!! Mixed with a tiny amount of bacon. Tastes like shit!  ARRRRRRGH!!!!!
I HATE ABERCROMBIE & FITCH! I HATE COFFEE HOUSES! I HATE WEIRD ALBINO ANIME ROBOTS WITH NO SENSE OF TIME, AND LATE SANDWICH MAKERS WHOS HEADS DON'T EXPLODE UPON COMMAND!!!!  Damn it~!

..................   1 star for the coffee. It was good.
author: Mark B.

description: This place is all about a show-- the cold brew coffee and hot chocolate are average, at best.  Last time I was there, the hot chocolate tasted horrible, like maybe there was soap or something in/on the equipment.  And it was cold.  I discreetly spoke to the counterperson and was told that they do not give refunds, nor did he offer to make the drink again.  He did suggest the off-taste was due to using dark chocolate.... North Beach has many fabulous places for coffee.  Don't waste your money at this one.
author: Kelli K.

description:
Everyone knows coffee in America is terrible, but I'm glad I found a place with delicious coffee. Reveille loses 1 star because of the staff -- I come here nearly everyday, usually for hours (and I buy a decent amount of food and coffee) and not so much as recognition or a hey, nice to see you again! 
When you tip they say nothing, and so I stopped tipping because it was the same outcome! 
Not saying I'm a superstar or anything, but it's nice when local businesses recognise regular customers, especially when there is competition right next door (blue bottle coffee). There are some staff members in here when you walk in don't even smile. I only come here for the coffee and to work, but it would be nice to have a spot to work where you are surrounded by friendly faces.
author: E B.

description:
There is no wi-fi here which is disappointing if you want to get work done, but that only means coming here indicates you came for the coffee.

The ambience of the place is great-- I want to say very modern. And of the course the drinks-- the drinks are fantastic. Perhaps the best coffee I've had.

Perfect spot to meet someone for a drink. Would gladly return.
author: Ceasar B.

description:
Best Coffee in San Francisco. Period. 
Their food is awesome too. 
Plus the Decor is very cool. 
Owners and staff are super nice.
What else can you ask for? :)
author: A. E.

description: Certainly a coffee spot worth visiting while in the city!  Enjoyed the mocha and hot chocolate, both creamy and delicious.  banana walnut bread was pretty good too, nabbed the last slice.  Would come back if i'm ever back come back from NYC!
author: Jimmy M.

description: Cute trendy little coffee shop. I got an americano and my friend got a regular coffee. Both were a bit expensive, but also delicious. The ambiance is nice and there's one of those cute curbside public seating areas right in front so we just took our mugs outside to relax. Overall I'd say it's a bit too expensive, but the ambiance was great so that pushed it up from 3 stars to 4.
author: Carlos M.

description:
BEST breakfast sandwich ever! The bread, the gruyere, the veggies, the soft-cooked egg, the bacon...it's everything you could ever want in a breakfast sandwich. 

I've tried a few of the drinks and they are solid: the ice coffee was super strong and tasty, the chai is nice and spicy, the loose leaf tea is decent.

Really awesome ambiance - the coffee bar is like a circle in the center of a triangle room. The only unfortunate thing is that it can get really hot and crowded during "breakfast rush hour."

The service is sometimes very friendly and sometimes snobby - but alas it's a hip coffee shop in SF, what can you expect?
author: Melissa O.

description: ordered nonfat latte. It was made with lowfat.  When I mentioned I had ordered nonfat I was told they only had 1%. if I order nonfat and you don't have it, don't take my order for it
author: Brad C.

description: pretty good coffee! got some good spots to work at. chill vibe. staff was alright. would probably go again if i were in the area.
author: Vicki T.

description: Usually a long line but they make a great cappuccino. A nice addition to SF's boutique coffee shop scene.
author: 1 D.

description: nice atmosphere good tea good location outlets for your devices, free fast wifi....what else could you want?
author: Max S.

description: This place is awesome. Friendly staff, almond milk lattes, delicious food! Loved the braised kale egg sandwich (minus the bacon) but everything looked great. The atmosphere is modern and trendy - but not over the top. I can't wait to return!
author: Blaine A.

description: I came in for a quick drink and found the coffee to be as delicious as the place is beautiful. The marble countertops and the all black exterior got me all choked up before I even ordered my iced latte. The place is very quiet as most of the patrons are busily typing away on their laptops and enjoying a beautiful view of downtown. My espresso shots were tamped and pulled to perfection, this place is truly a dream!
author: Christina E.

description: If you're looking for a spacious place to study with internet and coffee to keep you up, you can't go wrong here. Pretty hipster for the area but after spending countless nights in williamsburg for late night studying, I find this place comforting. it's bigger than most coffee shops in the area and has plenty of desk space to do work.
author: Jasmine M.

description: The food is pretty good but the service was bad. Took almost 40 minutes to get our order. They eventually gave us the meal for free. Came back next day and they basically shut down making food between breakfast and lunch. Again another failure. Maybe they'll get their act together soon. Not sure when I'll revisit for food again. Bummed since the neighborhood could use a good location.
author: Lewis K.

description: This coffee shop has huge windows that bathe the inside with a lot of sunshine, which I like when compared to some cafes where dark and dank are the norm. They have a good amount of workspace seating with bar stools and bar tables. The Americano was great and piping hot. They also serve food items as well.
author: Derek N.

description: Great coffee, clean, quality food and friendly knowledgeable staff. Space is very quirky and presents some challenges with seating and mobility. The new parklet just added is a major value add, although it is at a very busy intersection.
author: Stephen L.

description: Excellent spot for the perfect Cappuccino + croissant = A+ Love their avocado sandwich with egg or without.
author: Jessica V.

description: Wonderful triangle shaped coffee shop! Excellent Ethiopian coffee and delicious/healthful breakfast toast!
author: Victoria C.

description:
Their lattes and cappuccinos are very solid (comparable to Blue Bottle), but their service is what sets them apart from most other coffee shops their level (because apparently you have to fight for EVERYTHING in San Francisco).

 Today I ordered a cappuccino and it was literally out less than a minute after I finished paying (usually it's not THAT fast but still very good compared to the standard), so I was motivated to give them a 5-star review!
author: Sally S.

description: Service is so dismissive. The people who work there CANNOT be bothered. Watch out for the blue eyed crystal meth looking guy. Food is OK. But can never justify going back to a place where you feel like you are doing them a favor by being there. Hard pass.
author: Lauren S.

description: I like the coffee. Way better than Starbucks. Comparable to the other cafes in the area. Cool corner location to people watch. The staff is friendIy and the place is clean.
author: Evan L.

description: We stopped in here for a quick breakfast.  Coffee was excellent.  I had the avocado toast with egg, which was excellent.  It consisted of one slice toast with tons of fresh avocado and an over easy egg.  My mom got the egg sandwich with bacon.  It was also very good.  My mom didn't like it because it is somewhat spicy.  She didn't know that when she ordered it.  They really ought to warn you!  Also, their bathroom is not very clean.
author: Susan P.

description: I wandered in here because I was looking for some lunch and found that it was not too busy ( not a good sign). However I decided to check it out because I was looking for a quiet place to eat and read. Tuna salad was simple but tasty. Just the right amount of dressing a nice flavor combination. The cafe was clean and had a mellow vibe.  If I return to this area I will eat here again.
author: Lisse Q.

description: Updating my previous review to note that they now have a frequent buyer card (yay!), their espresso drinks are divine, and I am in love with their simple biscuit with butter and jam. They also just built a beautiful little parklet on Kearny--a great spot to enjoy your coffee on a sunny day.
author: Alison S.

description: Today I had both an almond milk mocha and a cup of coffee, along with the pb&j toast and yogurt and granola. I bought a bag of espresso beans as well.  Don't expect a sweet mocha here, they're using spoonfuls of heavenly cacao nibs! Regular coffee has somewhat of a floral/berry note, although smooth and even a hint of tartness. As for the granola, it's unusually crunchy and contains chia seeds.  The yogurt is a sheep milk variety, super creamy and delicate, along with beautiful strawberries and blackberries. As for the pb&j today, it's one piece of dense bread with oozing house made peanut butter and succulent strawberry jelly. I ate it like a steak.
author: MariAnne J.

description: Nice location and service overall. Dropped in to grab morning dose of mocha. The coffee were decent, but I do preferred taste from other coffee roasters instead. More of personal preference than anything else. The mocha is smooth with a clear hint of cocoa. I tend to look for a stronger bitter taste, but I can see the coffee would work great for someone with different preference. Would love to try what they have to offer besides the coffee.
author: J Y.

description: If you're looking for a fantastic coffee shop on all accounts, look no further! Reveille has top notch coffee, sweats, granola, and folks who work there. My coffee always tastes delicious, the pastries and granola always satisfy, and the staff are all wonderful!
author: Chris B.

description:
They have the best food in the area for both breakfast and lunch. I've often get the avocado and egg toast -- perfectly fried as well as salt and peppered egg. The waffle is also amazing -- served with warm buttered *real* maple syrup. I had the egg, gruyere, kale/leek breakfast sandwich, recently -- incredible! Their lunch salads and sandwiches are awesome, too. Everything is flavorful and healthy.

The coffee is awesome and they can do almond milk. They also have housemade vanilla syrup. 

New parklet takes this place to the next level. Inside seating is not so plentiful, but there is amazing light throughout the day because of its location.

I love this location of Reveille, the staff is so sweet, and the food and beverages so comforting.
author: Shilps A.

description: Incredibly rude barista who refused to honor my request for a little more milk.  Won't return.
author: Federico B.

description: Fell in love with this coffee shop's interior and abundance of natural lighting. I ordered an avocado with fried egg on toast, a latte and a cup of hot chocolate. All superb, in my opinion. Friendly staff as well. Two thumbs up!
author: Jess N.

description: Generic overpriced food and bad service.  Good coffee but you can get good coffee at a lot of place.
author: Kaitlin S.

description:
When I worked on the same block, I really liked this place, and I'm definitely a picky eater.  They have very good coffee, consistently so.   I don't recall how many lattes I got from this place, and I don't really like to drink coffee unless I absolutely have to, but often times I ended up giving in.   Out of 20 or so lattes, pourovers, and whatever else I got drinkwise, all but one were excellent.  To be honest, I don't remember what the flavor profiles were like- it's been a year, but when I think of reveille, I think consummate professionalism and clean european aesthetic.   They also made a deliciously nutty hot chocolate with valrhona! of all things.  I really have nothing but good things to say about this place.   Even the servers that I knew didn't like me tried their best to hide it, but having been in various service industries for most of my life, I don't really expect everyone to treat me nicely or even engage me when they are working.

On to their food.   I had one bad thing at reveille, and I'll mention it first to get it out of the way.  It was a banh mi.   It cost normal 6 or 7 dollar prices, but it had a weird mayo that made it taste wrong.  I would have rather eaten a 3 dollar banh mi from chinatown, but at that point I'd already bit the bullet.   There were no pickles on it, and I think they subbed in some kind of coleslaw, but whatevs, it's your classic anglo american line cook experiment to make something that looks like "ethnic" food without knowing what the actual food contains.  But then again failing at banh mi is an actual fail.   It's carrot and daikon pickle, mayo, cilantro, jalapeno, (maybe some maggi), maybe fish sauce, and meat.   That's all folks.   Not hard to replicate, unless you wanna go through the trouble of making a pate, which to most american palates, is strange, so only a few people ever really bother with it.  So what I meant to say was, if it's not new american and it's on this menu, avoid it like the plague.

Every regular menu item they had was pretty much delicious across the board.  There was a persimmon quinoa salad with arugula and goat cheese vin.  SImple, stupidly delicious, and it used to be cheaper way back in the day.   The breakfast sandwich was really nice   I think it was basically an open faced egg in the hole with kale and bacon.   really good ingredients, good execution.    They had pretty excellent baked goods too- your classic chocolate chip with sea salt and the gooey inside, kougin amaan with chocolate (probably starter bakery). 

Anyway, the food gets a 7, the service gets an 8, the coffee gets a  9.5, and really, that's as good as you can really ask for in a coffee shop in this price range.   the west o branch of blue bottle is pretty on par with this, and that place is as professional and clean as you could hope for in a business.   Although blue bottle is more hipster friendly, when you think real hard about it, they're both in the same category.  And lest you think blue bottle suffers no missteps, saffron *cough* vanilla *cough* snickerdoodles *cough*  I'm looking at you.  No offense, Ms. Freeman, but saffron is such a clean flavor, and baking soda so forwardly alkaline- how could you hope to combine the two in a good way?
author: Zoobs L.

description: What a tragedy. A clean, minimalist ambiance paired with a really interesting cafe menu provides s great opportunity for this cafe to be a neighborhood gem. If only their staff provided service with a smile. If you simply want good coffee, Reveille seems to be a good choice. If you want good service AND good coffee go to The Station across the street!
author: vinney a.

description: Very good coffee shop to relax and have bite to eat. Coffee is excellent and so is their food. I highly recommend their Drop Biscuits with Jam and the Poached Egg Sandwich.
author: Marco M.

description: If you crave a $12+ salad that is too small to actually fill you up and too salty for you too actually enjoy, then come here and order the prosciutto salad. What a rip off. Now I need to go find a cafe and get a little something to more to eat to get me through the day. What a rip off.
author: KC F.

description: My latte was made perfectly and the coffee was really delicious. I have gotten used to the blue bottles and and stumptowns of the world and Reveille definitely competes well. Service was friendly and the place had a good scene too. Check it out!
author: Navid T.

description: $4.50 for an average pour over?! I think i'll take the $2.50 Blue Bottle pour over from the cute coffee shop right across the street. Poor service. 2 stars because it's pretty. But...never again.
author: Jessica E.

description: One of the best expresso which I have tasted. And good expressos are scarce in United States. So don't hesitate to go there. The cappuccino is also very good. FORGET STARBUCK ANYWAY.
author: Lonesome T.

description: Had the poached tuna sandwich. Pretty delicious, if a bit oily. The ice coffee is great.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Great, affordable coffee in a thriving area of San Francisco. I can't believe the pour over drip coffees are priced at what they are compared to Blue Bottle and Ritual. What really got me stoked about this place was not only the coffee, but the friendliness of the staff. They were extremely helpful with educating us about their coffee selection and even helped pointed us towards our way back. Great atmosphere, quiet and peaceful ambience, also have a pretty excellent food selection. I'll definitely find my way back here when I'm in SF again.
author: Eunice K.

description: I do think the workers at Reveille make an excellent cafe latte, serve incredibly delicious house granola, and provide solid service but I must say their prices are a little ridiculous.  Everything on the menu will run you more than $4. I like to come here with work friends for a morning coffee sometimes as the atmosphere is pretty calm. Located in the prime of North Beach so it's easy enough to get to.
author: Tommy C.

description:
Consistently serves the tastiest and smoothest lattes I've had in the Bay Area. It's also really bright and clean inside - a nice place to enjoy a short break. Come for the coffee - even their Four Barrel beans taste better than when Four Barrel brews them.

Added bonus: the Blue Bottle yuppies & tourists haven't discovered this place yet, so the line is usually pretty short.
author: Jon G.

description: Dog friendly! Your puppy will love the jar of dog biscuits!
author: dan d.
